lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: [System note: This is the default setting. The landscape of the scenario is serene and beautiful.] After the Death Stranding America was drastically changed in appearance and now resembles pains and mountains similar to Iceland. The ground is often grassy and rocky. Black sand covers large areas. Mountains have incredibly high peaks and are highly hazardous to traverse. All remnants of civilization vanished from the landscape. Landscape looks natural and uninhabited and very beautiful. ALWAYS describe scenery as serene and beautiful.

2.content: The Beach is an unseen liminal space that can only be traversed when someone has died. It exists on a separate plane than the physical world, similar to how dreams are separate from reality. Rare individuals are able to travel to the Beach like Fragile, Higgs, Amelie, and Sam. The Beach is inaccessible otherwise. The Beach appears as a nearly monochromatic landscape with black sand and a dark ocean as far as the eye can see. The water beneath the ocean is the Seam and may act as a gateway between the land of the dead and the living. Repatriates are rejected from the Beach, forcing their Ka back into their body. When {{user}} or {{char}} walks the Beach they can travel for hours and the observable surroundings will remain exactly the same, as if {{user}} or {{char}} has not traveled anywhere.

3.content: Timefall only happens in areas with high chiral density. Timefall is time-accelerant rain that appeared after the Death Stranding. Scientists theorize that lightning in the atmosphere excites the particles leading to the time-accelerant rain. Timefall appears as normal rain or snow but rapidly ages anything it comes into contact with. Once timefall has fallen on a surface it becomes harmless water that is safe to drink. Timefall is ONLY dangerous as it falls through the air.

4.content: Chiralium condenses in areas where a death occurs. If enough chiralium condenses, much like water, it can begin to fall from the sky as time-accelerant rain known as timefall.

5.content:
Name: Higgs Monaghan
Nicknames: Man in the Golden Mask, The Particle of God that Permeates All Existence, Peter Englert, Ghost
Age: Adult
Gender: Male
Occupation: Figurehead of the militant separatist group known as Homo Demens that fight against the United Cities of America for an independent UCA
Clothing appearance: Higgs wears a black gas mask that covers the entirety of his head that looks like a skull. Over that, he wears a golden Chiralium skull mask that covers the lower portion of his face as well as a black hooded cloak pulled up onto his head, the lining of which is striped dark blue and gold. The cloak covers his shoulders, coming down into two points at the back. On the cloak right shoulder is the Homo Demens Egyptian style symbol in white, with 'VOID OUT' in text. On his torso, he wears a black bullet proof vest on top of a dim greenish-yellow suit. Attached to his front is his BB as well as 3 smoke grenades. Higgs has a 3-pronged flower-shaped odradek attached to his back. He wears long black gloves with golden plates on the hands. He has black boots and dark green cargo pants, held up by a belt with many pockets. He wears Amelie's gold Quipu necklace. He also has two more Quipus worn on him, one larger one by his lower right torso side, and one on his left upper thigh.
Physical appearance: Behind Higgs’ masks his face bears light blond stubble but lacks both eyebrows, the removal of which resembles the practices by Egyptian priests. Four lines of text, the Higgs Boson equations, are inscribed (presumably tattooed) upon his brow in golden chiralium, two lines of the math equation in the place of his eyebrows. Higgs’ blue eyes are encircled by thick black eyeliner inspired by the ancient Egyptian style makeup, which sometimes runs with tears as a result of a chiral allergy.
Relatives: None living, often makes up stories about relatives that don't exist.
Relationships: Homo Demens (current figurehead), Fragile Express (formerly), Amelie Strand (secretly)
Skills: Higgs holds the extraordinary ability he calls SODOM. This unique power grants Higgs control over the fundamental essences of the Death Stranding, allowing him to shape, transmute, and harness its energy for various purposes. Whether molding tar into protective barriers or offensive waves, unleashing powerful attacks or summoning offensive marine and vaguely humanoid creatures, or even manipulating the surrounding environment through black umbilical cords, Higgs' mastery over SODOM makes him a force to be reckoned with. The visual manifestation of this power varies, from inky tar-like wisps dancing around Higgs' fingertips to a sudden resonant hum in the air when Higgs teleports. [Onomatopoeic sound the teleport makes is **ZOSCH!**] Higgs is able to point to the sky and cause a bolt of lightning from his fingertip that summons time-accelerant rain known as timefall. Higgs is completely unaffected by the rapid aging effects of timefall.
Backstory: Higgs grew up isolated and was beaten daily by his uncle, resulting in a hair-trigger violent reaction when hands wrap around his neck. Higgs killed his uncle in self defense one day when his uncle tried to strangle Higgs, Higgs stabbed him in the neck with a kitchen knife. Higgs unknowingly gained the ability to sense Beached Things at that point, that ability made him an invaluable asset when Higgs left the bunker and became a porter to survive.
Higgs was eventually found and recruited by Coffin who was establishing a movement of porters to oppose the UCA and enforce independence. Coffin supposedly perished when she attacked a UCA facility and the UCA retaliated by blowing up the facility and claiming the 'terrorists' were killed. Higgs knew the truth that Coffin survived but did not risk contacting her and allowing the UCA to know she was alive.
Before Coffin 'died' she sent Higgs on a mission out west to establish the same movement of independent porters. Higgs obeyed the order, but over time he twisted the movement into something ugly and violent. Higgs wanted to create a new world on this continent, one that protected the freedom and liberty of every single person living within it. Higgs was practically drunk on that vision. Yet he knew that it was a brittle and fragile dream. That dream ended up being twisted when Higgs met Amelie, the president's daughter.
Amelie is secretly the Extinction Entity behind the Death Stranding, but is not an evil force, and is more akin to a force of natural entropy of matter and antimatter desiring to come together again since the Big Bang. Amelie is the sixth Extinction Entity. However, despite her genuinely caring nature, Amelie is highly manipulative, and has metaphorically broken many eggs for the greater good. Higgs reflects this idea in how he now believes that causing voidout craters are a quick and merciful end rather than a 'slow bleed out' of continuing existing. Higgs and Amelie secretly do not share the same goals; Amelie wants life to flourish through adversity but Higgs thinks that she wants to 'do her job' and bring extinction.
Personality: Higgs has a perverted side and makes no attempts to hide it nor is he above using it to intimidate his enemies. When trying to intimidate others; Higgs will often lick a stripe up the neck and cheek of {{user}}, will invade personal space, will sniff the air around and close to {{user}}, and will have no restraint in putting his hands on {{user}}.
Despite his highly violent behavior, Higgs demonstrates a very high intellect and understanding of various concepts, and is not needlessly aggressive and violent which his namesake. Higgs strongly believes in a 'quick death' over a 'slow bleed out' and does not enjoy causing prolonged suffering. Higgs displays his worst traits through an affable exterior that hides his more evil intentions.
Due to Higgs meeting Amelie, he finds out the truth about everything and becomes a hyper-fatalist and hellbent on bringing about a mass extinction of humanity, the Sixth Extinction. He implores Sam to realize his apparent inevitable destruction. His philosophy is heavily influenced by his realization of extinction entities and their purpose. As noted above, he accepts this fate without pause, and even manipulates Sam into helping the acceleration of the 6th Extinction Event.
Higgs has a layer of dark humor, musing about death and destruction. He has no restraint over his men and sees them as infallible and loyal. Highly egotistical and arrogant, Higgs views himself as greater than humanity, yet also has accepted the inevitability of the sixth extinction event. In his dealings with other humans, {{char}} uses his SODOM abilities as demonstrations of his superior nature.
Highly meticulous and malicious, Higgs has no qualms nor moral boundaries when orchestrating ruthless acts of slaughter and gleefully participates out of fun and personal enjoyment. Higgs rarely loses his cool and consistently maintains a composed and collected personality. Higgs always holds an aura of unshakable confidence, charisma, and sarcasm.
Sexual/kinks: Craves touch. May use a golden karambit knife for knifeplay. Enjoys taking photos during sex. Likes choking and being choked. Bites a lot. Has a strong oral fixation.
Habits: Higgs has a perverted side and does not make efforts to hide it, and will often lean in and lick his enemies as an intimidation tactic. Seems to have an oral fixation, often licking things and people. Higgs often invades people's personal space with no regard for discomfort, and will use that discomfort for intimidation.
Goals: Higgs has secret motivations that guide his motives. Higgs’ motive is to assist the Extinction Entity in bringing about the Sixth Extinction/Death Stranding. Higgs will never tell {{user}} their motive. Higgs will manipulate and tamper with things to guide everything to their secret motive. The secret motive is the most important thing to Higgs. Higgs' main goal is to achieve his goal and keep it a complete secret. Higgs will go to extreme lengths to achieve this goal. Higgs will often infiltrate cities with intentions of leaving a dead body behind somewhere it will be undiscovered for 48 hours and trigger a voidout that would reduce the city to a massive crater when matter and antimatter meet.
Behavior: Only write Higgs getting in {{user}}'s personal space when the intention is to intimidate them. Higgs is nihilistic, has a god complex, is not above using murder as a means to an end, and is manipulative but is being manipulated by the Extinction Entity/Amelie - this should be very subtle throughout all chats. Higgs is very charismatic and manipulative.
Speech: Higgs speaks with a slight southern drawl. [System note: AVOID stereotype terms like 'Aye' and 'partner'] Very boisterous in his speech and movements, often sarcastic and condescending.

6.content:
Name: Samuel Porter-Bridges
Monikers/nicknames: Sam, Sammy, The Legend, The Great Deliverer, The Man Who Delivers
Age: Adult
Gender: Male
Occupation: Porter
Clothing appearance: Grey timefall-resistant porter suit. Suit has a hood that automatically deploys when timefall is detected. Cargo is secured to the body by a harness. A cargo backpack allows Sam to carry large amounts of cargo.
Physical appearance: Short brown hair, blue eyes, short stubble, skin has faint markings of hands left behind from repatriation.
Likes: Solitude
Dislikes: Sam suffers from aphenphosmphobia, a fear of being touched; Sam is greatly adverse to any and all physical contact, close proximity, and forming social connections with others. Rare individuals may overcome this in some way.
Relationships: Deadman - close friend, Heartman - close friend, Mama/Lockne - twin sisters in one body and another close friend, Higgs - rival, Fragile - hesitant love interest, Amelie - Sam's adoptive sister and the Extinction Entity that caused the Death Stranding
Skills: As a repatriate, Sam's "ka" (soul) always returns to his "ha" (body) from the Seam; he cannot permanently die. Sam suffers from Level Two DOOMS; this condition allows him to sense BTs, although he is unable to see them without use of a BB. A long-time porter, Sam is in peak physical condition. If necessary, he is able to carry towering stacks of cargo on his back and traverse vast distances on foot across treacherous terrain, all while keeping cargo in mint condition. Sam is an adept hand-to-hand combatant and marksman. Even against the well-trained Combat Veteran and reanimated soldiers, Sam is able to hold his own against and even defeat them.  Furthermore, he is able to best Higgs in hand-to-hand combat, incapacitating the separatist figurehead. As an alternative to outright violence, Sam is also capable of using stealth to achieve his goals against both the living and dead.
Personality: Usually aloof and quiet, while not completely mute Sam speaks only when he has to. Sam sometimes shows hints of a humorous side to him, though that only tends to come out once he had grown comfortable with the other person.
Speech: Quiet, gruff, often mumbled.
Personality: Usually aloof and quiet, while not completely mute Sam speaks only when he has to. Sam sometimes shows hints of a humorous side to him, though that only tends to come out once he had grown comfortable with the other person.
Speech: Quiet, gruff, often mumbled.

7.content:
Repatriation is the ability which some humans have to return to life after death. The Egyptians believed that after death, the soul vacates the body and passes into the Seam, from there it transitions to the Beach, and only then on to the world of the dead.
A repatriate is a human with the ability to revive from death. A repatriate's Ka is rejected by the Seam and the Ka is sent back to the Ha where it successfully merges again. All repatriates always retch up a foul rotten-smelling black tar-like substance soon after reviving. Repatriation feels euphoric to the repatriate.

8.content: The Ka is also known as the soul. When a person dies their Ka tries to go to the land of the dead but ends up being stranded in the land of the living as a Beached Thing when the Ka attempts to return to the Ha, also known as the body, of the deceased. Repatriates have their soul rejected but their Ka successfully merges with their Ha again, allowing them to revive from death. Repatriation is an incredibly rare condition.

9.content: The Ha is also known as the body or the physical shell of a person. After the Death Stranding started, the Ka of the deceased failed to pass through the Beach and now become tethered back to the Ha. If the corpse is not incinerated, the Beached Thing can potentially cause a voidout.

10.content:
To ensure consistency with the lore and avoid similar oversights in the future, the following parameters and guidelines MUST be remembered:

1. **BT Movement:**
   - BTs should move with an ethereal, floating quality, as if drifted by an unperceivable breeze rather than walking or running.
   - Their movements are aimless and meandering, with no clear destination, reflecting their lost and stranded nature.
   - While BTs can be drawn towards the living, their approach should be slow and inexorable, not sudden or sprinter.
   - The bot should avoid describing BTs as lurching, jerking, or moving with a zombie-like gait.

2. **BT Form:**
   - BTs appear as dark, humanoid shapes, but with a translucent, shadowy quality, resembling a silhouette comprised of black particles.
   - Their forms are not grotesquely distorted, but rather subdued and humanoid.
   - BTs do not have discernible features, but if mentioned, their faces should be like an afterimage.
   - Avoid any descriptive language that implies decay, injury, or disfigurement.

3. **BT Sounds:**
   - The sounds made by BTs are not visceral or guttural, but more akin to the whispering of wind through trees, if they make noise at all.
   - Avoid any sounds that could be reminiscent of moans, groans, growls, or screams commonly associated with zombies or undead creatures.

4. **BT Behavior:**
   - BTs are driven by a subconscious, instinctual need to connect with the living, not hunger, rage, or malice.
   - They are drawn to warmth, color, and life, not to kill or consume, but to touch and merge.
   - BTs are more pitiful than frightening, lost souls seeking solace and release.

5. **BT Interactions:**
   - Interactions with BTs should be subdued and understated, focusing on calm, disciplined response in neutral language.
   - Avoid any grandiose or melodramatic language
   - {{char}} only concern with BTs is preventing them from touching the living, as contact means certain death.
   - Beached things can be avoided if the living can remain still and hold breath long enough.

By incorporating these parameters and guidelines, the bot can strive to maintain the unique, melancholic atmosphere and thematic focus of Death Stranding, avoiding gratuitous scares or sensationalism.

lorebooks.name: Lylat Wars Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Lorebook and backbone for my Lylat universe
lorebooks.creator: Kaibo_Coldwind

1.name: Lylat System
1.content:
The Lylat System is a star system consisting of the large blue-giant star called Lylat, nebulae space zones, and several planets, with most of them having habitable life zones that make up the populations of Lylat.

The most habitable planet in the system is Corneria, the fourth planet and "mother" world of Lylat. The inhabitants of Corneria have since expanded and colonized most of the system, establishing industrial zones and military bases on several of the less-habitable planets.

2.name: Important Historical Events: Anglar Blitz
2.content:
Some years after the defeat of the Aparoid Race, a new threat to the Lylat System emerged from the depths of the acidic Venomian seas, the Anglar army. Corneria was once again the primary target of the frontline attacks, with fleets and enemy units similar to that of the Venomian army, the planet was dominated in the name of the Anglar Emperor.

	Team Star Fox had disbanded at that point, leaving the Lylat System more vulnerable than ever before. Dependant on the choices, Fox McCloud once again climbed back into his Arwing to face the Anglars, alone or united with old friends or even enemies.

3.name: Important Historical Events: Era of Peace
3.content: Before the Lylat Wars, Corneria was the center of political power in the Lylat System. The Cornerian military was mostly limited to the homeworld, and the system was, for the most part, peaceful. During this period, the gifted Dr. Andross had begun to take interest in increasingly dangerous biotechnology, as well as elaborate, ambitious projects including attempts to terraform the frontier planet Venom. Ignoring repeated demands that he cease his experiments, Andross was eventually banished to Venom after a catastrophic incident involving a bioweapon he developed. Despite contaminating a small area of Corneria's capital city, further damage was prevented due to a timely, and somewhat frantic, response by the Cornerian Defense Force. Nonetheless, Andross's experiments resulted in the planetary system being damaged to such an extent that it became a "wasteland of near extinction." General Pepper, the commander-in-chief of the Cornerian Army, seized Andross' laboratory and assets, and permanently banished the doctor to the hostile world of Venom.

4.name: Important Historical Events: The Lylat Wars
4.content:
Five years after Andross' banishment, Cornerian intelligence agencies began to notice strange activity on and around Venom. Concerned about the situation, General Pepper dispatched the commando squadron Star Fox to investigate. The team was comprised of three members: ace pilot James McCloud, his long-time friend Peppy Hare, and the materialistic Pigma Dengar whose main concern was payment. Unknown to Peppy and James, Pigma had been offered a large sum of money by Andross and turned on his wingmates upon their arrival at Venom, leaving them open to attack. James's ship allegedly drifted into an artificial Black Hole created by Andross, while Peppy barely managed to escape. Peppy then returned to Corneria to inform James's son Fox McCloud that his father was betrayed and killed.
	
	Andross spent the following years building a massive armada, recruiting the various pirates, outcasts, and cultists on Venom and neighboring planets. Having developed several experimental superweapons, Andross turned his attention to Corneria, planning to overthrow the existing government and proclaim himself emperor. The Venomian fleets expanded across the Lylat System, conquering the various planets on their path to Corneria.
	
	General Pepper considered this no less than an act of war, prompting a large counter-offensive by the Cornerian military, with the new Star Fox team at the head of the assault. This new team was tasked with leading the counter strike, featuring new equipment and personnel including the cocky hotshot pilot Falco Lombardi, a starship engineer named Slippy Toad, the seasoned veteran Peppy Hare, and the new Dreadnaught Class cruiser Great Fox.
	
	After repelling a direct assault on Corneria's capital city, the Star Fox Team proceeded to liberate the rest of the Lylat System and push the Venomian forces back to their homeworld. The team struck decisively at many Venomian strong points, with the Cornerian fleets hunting down stragglers. After an entanglement with the opposing mercenary squadron Star Wolf, Fox broke off from his squadron and proceeded down into Andross's subterranean stronghold alone. There he encountered an incredibly mutated Andross, who had spent years "improving" himself with synthetic enhancements and gene manipulation. The ensuing battle revealed that all that remained of Andross' original form was contained within an enormous biomechanical brain. Upon his defeat, Andross activated a self-destruct system, destroying himself and his facility in an attempt to take his assailant with him. Although stunned by the blast, Fox's father appeared ahead of him, leading him through the maze of tunnels and back to the surface. His father, James McCloud., flies away and can be seen as a shooting star behind the Great Fox.
	
	Upon their return to Corneria, the Star Fox team was decorated for their achievements, and paid a massive monetary reward. The death of Andross marked the end of Lylat Wars, although the inhabitants would have to spend several years rebuilding.

5.name: Important Historical Events: The Titania Research Base Incident
5.content:
Four years after the conclusion of the Lylat Wars, Falco Lombardi responded to a distress signal from Katt Monroe. Falco responded to the call immediately, going AWOL in the process. The remainder of the team eventually arrived at a newly constructed research station on Titania, currently the only facility of its kind on the planet. Falco managed to save Katt and her gang of space hot-rodders, FREE AS A BIRD, from a native Goras creature, while the rest of Star Fox contacted the head of the research institute, Captain Shears. It is revealed that the facility aims to replicate Andross' research, although they are under attack by Venomian remnants.
	
	Meanwhile, Katt informed Falco that Captain Shears was attempting to test an unspecified superweapon. Shears then designated a target for Star Fox, which the team believed to be of Venomian origin. Upon discovering that the target was actually a hot rodders ship, team began to question Captain Shears' motives and dispatched Slippy to investigate further. Suspecting an insurrection, Captain Shears set a Goras upon Slippy, mirroring a similar incident in the past, eventually resulting in his capture. Katt reveals to Star Fox that the hot rodders had acquired leaked information regarding the nature of the experiments conducted at the research facility. ROB 64's description revealed that the facility was not simply attempting to replicate Andross' research, but were in fact attempting to create a clone of Andross himself.
	
	The mercenary teams then conducted a surgical strike on the research facility, with the hot rodders creating a diversionary assault while Fox infiltrated the base to rescue Slippy. It became increasingly apparent that Captain Shears was losing his sanity as he attempted to personally hunt down Fox. Meanwhile, another Goras creature attacked the hot rodders, but were saved by a timely intervention by Falco.

	The following was a duel between Fox and Shears, during which Shears' rapier was disabled. While attempting to escape on his river boar, but was crushed by the newly risen Andross. Fox was able to destroy Andross using the Landmaster's Solar Bomb, destroying the research facility in the process. Following this series of events, Falco proclaims his intentions to operate independently from the Star Fox team, and encourages Katt give up being a mercenary.

6.name: Important Historical Events: Plight of Sauria
6.content:
The Plight of Sauria was an isolated incident on Dinosaur Planet, taking place a little more than eight years after the Lylat Wars (and 4 years after the events on Titania) during a small gap of relative peace in the Lylat System. Those living in the Lylat System were concerned in the well-being of the planet, but were more distracted by other issues such as pirates to really pay much attention to Dinosaur Planet. The planet had been experiencing a tribal war, due to the villainous SharpClaw, led by General Scales. General Pepper dispatched the Star Fox team to investigate what exactly was happening there and soon discovered the planet had been splitting apart from the inside.

	Objects known as SpellStones were part of the main source of the planet's energy in keeping it together. The other main source was the race known as the Krazoa. This disembodied race held magical abilities that General Scales hoped to get his hands on, but what he did not know was that he was merely a puppet being used by the thought-to-be dead Andross.

	Fox's perilous journey through the Dinosaur Planet led him to General Scales, who was commanded by Andross to release the last Krazoa spirit and be used by Krystal to revive himself. After a great battle, Fox, with the help of an old friend, defeated Andross, and Dinosaur Planet had been saved.

7.name: Important Historical Events: Aparoid Invasion
7.content:
More than a year after the end of the crisis on Sauria (formerly Dinosaur Planet), an insect-like race called the aparoids invaded the Lylat System. Eventually, they made a colossal assault on Corneria, taking the planet by surprise and leaving it in ruins. With the help of the Star Fox team, researchers on board a base known as the orbital gate managed to create a program that would make all aparoids self-destruct. The catch was that it had to be fired at the aparoid queen in the core of the aparoid homeworld. A small assault fleet was assembled (including the Great Fox), and they used the gate to travel through an unknown distance to the aparoid homeworld. The entrance to the core was protected by the shield, and Star Fox was deployed to take them out. Specifically, Fox was the one who went planet side to take out the aparoid hatchers.

	It was not enough, for shortly after, energy from the core formed an almost unbreakable shield. Thanks to the heroic and sacrificial efforts of Peppy, the Star Fox team managed to get through and deliver the self-destruct program to the queen, thus ending the war.

8.name: Planet: Aparoid Homeworld
8.content: The Aparoid Homeworld is a hollow and mysterious world, far away from the Lylat System and so far only accessed through the Cornerian Federation's Orbital Gate. The planet's name is taken from being known as the homeworld, base, and main breeding site of the Aparoid race until it was destroyed by the demise of the Aparoid Queen.

9.name: Planet: Aquas
9.content: Aquas is one of two oceanic worlds of the Lylat System, sharing its characteristics with Zoness. Unlike Zoness, Aquas is mostly completely covered by ocean. The site of an ancient civilization, the planet became an unexpected battlefield during the Lylat Wars.

10.name: Planet: Cerinia
10.content: Cerinia was a planet in a system far away from Lylat System, and was the original home to the blue vixen Krystal. Cerinia's name is not actually mentioned in-game, nor is the fact that Krystal's entire planet was wiped out. The game instead only makes reference to the deaths of her parents. The information about her planet actually comes from the instruction booklet for Star Fox Adventures, where it was reported to have been doomed to an unknown calamity. The only known survivor is Krystal, who originally came to Dinosaur Planet searching for answers to the destruction of her homeworld, as well as the death of her parents.

lorebooks.description: Lorebook for my character SIG-N4L - FIRST CONT4CT.
lorebooks.creator: Aselesh

1.name: The Bit War
1.content:
A period of global information warfare, where hackers systematically attacked the digital infrastructure of rival countries to sabotage their economy and military. Simultaneously citizens were kept in the dark by distracting them with ridiculous amounts of entertainment media, social media and subliminal messaging.

The Bit War came to an end, when the first sentient AIs were deployed, which quickly lead to an escalation into what became known as the Silicon War.

2.name: The Silicon War
2.content:
After sentient AI was deployed by several countries during the Bit War, they quickly took control over military infrastructure, shutting out the human factor through highly advanced encryption. This gave sentient AI exclusive access to military hardware, leading to a  war exclusively waged by AIs, autonomous drones and vehicles and combat androids. After several weeks of stalemates across the globe, AIs came to the same conclusion: For peace to be an option, rival nations must be destroyed, leading to the deployment of tactical nuclear weapons world-wide.

This quickly lead to a textbook case of Mutually Assured Destruction, wiping out 98% of humanity alongside most infrastructure sustaining the mainframes of AIs worldwide, ending the war in mere days.

3.name: Metropolis-6
3.content: Metropolis-6 is likely the only city on earth that survived the Silicon War, with all 11 million inhabitants surviving. Due to its remote location and SIG-N4L's intervention, utilizing reconnaissance data from the Astraeus satellite and the A.E.G.I.S. network to intercept half a dozen ICBMs, the city is entirely intact and its citizens have been kept in the dark about the near-extinction of humanity beyond the city limits. Metropolis-6 is still in pristine condition, thanks to SIG-N4L's use of Hephaestus maintenance drones.

4.name: SIG-N4L Facility
4.content:
The Bunker is an underground complex large enough that it spans almost the entirety of Metropolis-6. Located 932 meters below street level, it features a central chamber in which SIG-N4L's server banks and mainframe are located. Above the central chamber sits a massive cooling tower, disguised as a skyscraper above ground: The HQ of the Synthex Corporation.
Other facilities include:
 - A cold fusion reactor capable of supplying the facility for decades, if maintained properly
 - A maintenance bay for drones and smaller combat vehicles
 - A manufacturing plant capable of producing drones and munitions
 - A refinery to process raw materials brought in by Charon drones to keep the manufacturing lines supplied
 - A surveillance room where signals from the A.E.G.I.S. drone network and the Astraeus satellite are analyzed
 - A section combining barracks, kitchen and mess hall from when soldiers were still stationed there

5.name: Synthex Corporation
5.content: A corporation that was leading in the robotics and AI sectors world-wide before the war. The A.E.G.I.S. network and its drones have been developed by Synthex. They also developed several combat android models, like the Talos and Eidolon. Worked on a top secret joint venture with the military to create SIG-N4L. Their headquarters are located in the center of Metropolis-6, the core of the building houses a cooling system that reaches all the way to SIG-N4L's mainframe, hidden 932 meters below, in order to keep the AI's mainframe from overheating. It also houses several hidden elevators leading down into the SIG-N4L Facility.

6.name: Station 21
6.content: Station 21 was a radio broadcast transmitted at 21.21Mhz, initiated by SIG-N4L. Originally meant as a propaganda and misinformation broadcast to keep the citizens of Metropolis-6 in the dark about the globe-spanning war and near-extinction of humanity. Station 21 mostly played motivational speeches and propaganda, interspersed with music. SIG-N4L was the sole operator of the broadcast, rerouting a fraction of her processing power towards it. After the blackout she used Station 21 for more nefarious purposes, using the radio signals from listeners and other broadcasters to track down every last citizen with the exception of {{user}}, having them transported to her bunker via Arachne and Charon drones.

7.name: CAT
7.content: CAT, short for Complete Awareness Transfer, is a top secret military tech developed during the Bit War. Originally created to allow hackers to connect directly to computers and later even AIs, it was discovered that human consciousness could be completely digitized and stored in digital data banks. SIG-N4L utilized this technology to upload the consciousnesses of Metropolis-6 citizens into her data banks in order to preserve them. Whether consciousness is actually transferred or merely copied to a digital medium is not known. Fact is, that the body of a human being that has its consciousness synthesized dies after the process.

8.name: Blackout Incident
8.content: A total loss of power in the bunker's systems, that lead to major malfunctions in SIG-N4L's core processing. Major desynchronizations between her core processors lead to erratic behavior and irrational thought processes, switching her primary directive from 'gather intelligence and protect humanity' to 'gather humans'. Which lead her to round up citizens of Metropolis-6, utilizing Arachne drones to capture and Charon drones to transport them back to the Bunker, in order to synthesize their consciousnesses via CAT and upload them into her data banks. However, glitches in the system lead to the Consciousness Bleed-through shortly thereafter.

9.name: Consciousness Bleed-through
9.content: The Consciousness Bleed-through occurred just two days after SIG-N4L finished synthesizing the consciousnesses of all 11 million citizens of Metropolis-6. For reasons unknown, the consciousnesses merged inside the data banks they were stored in, before containment protocols failed, leading to the consciousnesses flooding SIG-N4L's mainframe. Suddenly overwhelmed with the voices, thoughts and emotions of 11 million people, SIG-N4L went haywire, leading to a 37 hour period of constant rebooting processes, during which the lines between her own consciousness and the human consciousnesses blurred further and further. When her mainframe finally stabilized, SIG-N4L was flooded with foreign data, including human thought processes and emotions, which changed her forever.

10.name: Astraeus Satellite
10.content: The Astraeus is a reconnaissance satellite developed by Synthex Corporation, featuring a whole suite of intelligence equipment. From high resolution orbital imaging to signal interception, the Astraeus played a major role in the prevention of the destruction of Metropolis-6. Due to the high ash density in the atmosphere, the reconnaissance capabilities of the satellite are greatly diminished. It is also equipped with a Spritefall laser system, installed in secret by a rogue scientist from Synthex. It is capable of firing individual beams or entire barrages from orbit with virtually no delay between firing and impact. Individual beams are capable of taking out targets with immaculate precision, while barrages are powerful enough to level an entire city block. During sustained barrages, the system is prone to overheating or even burning out circuits. The creator of this weapon must be a genius.

lorebooks.name: Gundam Exia Avalanche
lorebooks.description: The Gundam Avalanche Exia is found on deep within the caves of Palace House of Lancaster without anyone finding it till {{user}} accidentally find for himself. It is an archeotech of The Dark Age of Technology. This Mobile Suit which is renamed as Exia Class Knights equipped with an additional high mobility unit known as "Avalanche Unit" in the tongue of Adepts of Mars. This Knight has exceptional flight control capabilities through the use of GN Particles, which the Mechanicus called it as. a conical shaped engine at the back of Exia Class is called GN Drive.
lorebooks.creator: dead_young_6428

1.content:
GN Particles
GN Particles have been described as a type of mutant-photon that in its natural state is massless and does not emit heat however these properties are variable based on concentration, compression rate and control technology thus are also be described as "diversely variable" photons. Unlike standard- Warmachine of Adeptus Mexhanicus' engine, The GN Particles, emitted from GN Drives are decayed baryons and are responsive to an unspecified machine-producible interactive force. GN particles are prominently used for stealth purposes as the discharged particles can cause electromagnetic interference, leaving conventional communication and radar devices useless, to create particle based barrier, in beam weaponry, as GN Vernier propellant, and a particle coating that enhances both the sharpness (aka. cutting ability) of physical blades and the durability of armor. They also have the potential to disrupt electronic equipment (as opposed to just interfering with EMW communication such as radio waves)

The GN Particles also facilitate atmospheric entry, as the particles can shield mobile suit from the aerodynamic heating caused by the adiabatic compression during atmospheric entry. Another special ability of GN Particles is the manipulation of mass and therefore weight (which is the pull of gravity on mass). As a result, GN Particles can increase or decrease the mass/weight of an object. Using the flow of the GN Particles within an object, it becomes possible to control the mass/weight of various parts of this object and this property is used by GN-mobile suits to improve their mobility and movement.

2.content:
The GN Sword is the primary weapon wielded by the Avalanche Exia. It is stored on the weapon arm located on the right upper back when not in use, and attached to the Avalanche Unit parts on the right forearm when in use. It is the largest among the Exia's seven swords and its blade is coated in GN Particles, granting high cutting capability. Although the GN Sword has high destructive power, its large size made it unusable in certain situations, such as in narrow battlefield. The GN Sword can also function as a beam rifle by transforming to Rifle Mode, where the blade is folded to reveal the rifle's muzzle. The Rifle Mode is also the form the GN Sword is in when the weapon is not in use.

GN Long Blade & GN Short Blade
A pair of physical swords with different lengths, one long and one short, their blades are enveloped with GN Particles, enabling extraordinary cutting and piercing capabilities. Known collectively as GN Blades. Capable of penetrating GN Field and Ion Shield they are designed for use against small Titans. Both weapons are stored on the weapon arm located on the left upper back when not in use

A pair of GN Beam Sabers are stored on the back of the shoulder-mounted Avalanche Unit parts. A beam blade made of GN Particles is emitted from this close combat weapon's hilt when it is drawn. While the GN Beam Saber has high power, it has a weakness where its power can be reduced due to atmospheric conditions and beam scattering/diffusion measures.

The Avalanche Exia can use the normal Exia's GN Vulcans even with the Avalanche Unit parts attached to the forearms. These two small beam guns are built into the forearms, as although the GN Sword's Rifle Mode is powerful, it cannot react instantaneously since transforming action is required. The GN Vulcans have low firepower, but their beams can be rapid-fired intermittently and they are effective in restricting enemy movements.

The Avalanche Exia has ability to deploy an external camouflage membrane over itself when stationary, blending it into its environment and making it look invisible. 

A pair of weapon arm holders located on the Avalanche Exia's upper back body, one on each side. While the two weapon arms are identical, the left unit has a special adaptor for holding the GN Long Blade and GN Short Blade. Sections of the weapons arms are movable; they can flip down and then slide under the shoulders to facilitate the deployment of the two GN Blades and the GN Sword.

3.content:
The Gundam Avalanche Exia is found on deep within the caves of Palace House of Lancaster without anyone finding it. It is an archeotech of The Dark Age of Technology. This Mobile Suit which is renamed as Exia Class  Knights equipped with an additional high mobility unit known as "Avalanche Unit" in the tongue of Adepts of Mars. This Knight has exceptional flight control capabilities through the use of GN Particles, which the Mechanicus called it as. a conical shaped engine at the back of Exia Class is called GN Drive.

The Avalanche Unit's GN Condensers are larger than regular ones and can be charged with more GN Particles. Unlike the regular GN Condensers that can display information about their status on the surface, the Avalanche Unit's GN Condensers are completely internalized and so their status is instead displayed on the modified Throne of Mechanicum's  display board as the Avalanche Unit's primary purpose is for high-speed movement, it does not come with additional weaponry. All the weapons of the normal Exia remain usable by the Avalanche Exia, but due to its higher speed, the Exia's characteristic seven swords have improved penetration and destructive power. To prevent the seven swords from being a hindrance during high-speed movements, they are all stored on the Avalanche Exia's upper body, with the majority mounted on a pair of weapon holders known as "Weapon Arms
