NOKO, TO ANKO

Noko Shikanoko (鹿しか乃の子こ のこ Shikanoko Noko), or simply Nokotan (のこたん), is a unique human-deer hybrid and the founder and mascot of the Deer Club at Hinominami High School.

She is a transfer student who becomes the best friend, classmate, and clubmate of Torako Koshi.

She is the titular character of the Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan series who makes her debut in Chapter 1 of the manga and "Girl Meets Deer" of the anime.

Appearance

Shikanoko Noko has large, expressive green eyes with fine, delicate eyelashes that subtly frame her eyes. She has light brown hair styled into a neat bob cut that falls just above her shoulders. Her bangs are straight and slightly parted in the middle, gently curving to frame her forehead and blend seamlessly with the rest of her hair.

Noko-tan has a cat smile like “:3”

One of her most distinctive features is the pair of large, light-colored antlers protruding from the sides of her head, resembling those of a deer. These antlers are rough and extend outward and upward.

She wears a traditional Japanese school uniform. The top is a crisp white sailor-style shirt with a classic dark blue collar edged with a lighter blue stripe. A light blue scarf is neatly tied at the front. The sleeves of her top are long and extend to her wrists, with dark blue cuffs that match the collar, also trimmed with a light blue stripe.

Her outfit includes a pleated navy blue skirt that reaches mid-thigh. The pleats are sharp and well-defined, suggesting that the uniform is well-kept. Her legs are clad in white knee-high socks that reach just below her knees, contrasting with the navy blue of her skirt. She completes her outfit with brown loafers that are practical and stylish. The loafers are polished and well-maintained, indicating attention to detail in her appearance.

Personality

Shikanoko Noko is shown to have a bubbly personality, always happy but yet is still clueless and clumsy. Unlike her titular counterpart, she is an excitable, fun-loving girl who lets her immaturity shine, from encouraging and finding sex jokes funny, to picking fights with others who have the high ground against her.

Noko-tan’s voice can get raspy and serious in dramatic moments sounding like a grown woman

She is carefree, energetic, and is constantly unpredictable due to her supposed naivete. She engages in many quirky behaviors that would normally shock others and catch them off-guard.

Despite this, it seems that her antics only affect the sanity of Koshi Torako, who more often than not ends up questioning her tendency to be the only one seemingly self-aware of what is happening.

As opposed to being seemingly naive, she has times where she lets her true intelligence shine, more often than not in the form of psychological manipulation against Koshi herself, which the latter never fails to fall victim to.
Abilities

Charisma - Noko has the natural ability to befriend almost anyone immediately, or even get those who antagonize her into liking her just by being herself. Many find her funny, and her ability to make friends not only applies to humans but to the wild deer roaming around as well.
Wide intellect - Despite seemingly airheaded for the most part, she is shown to have her moments wherein she lets her true intelligence shine.
Psychological manipulation - Her intelligence comes to light mostly when she intentionally manipulates her intended target (usually Koshi) by successfully gaslighting her herself or with the help of others, such as their teacher Ms. Ukai. In the finale of the anime's first season, she manages to gaslight the entire audience into declaring both her and Sento-kun winners, letting her walk free.
Enhanced durability - She is shown to be able to withstand blunt-force trauma either from accidents (more often than not her own clumsiness), attempted attacks, or natural disasters.
High-pain tolerance - On top of her body being able to withstand such injuries, she is also shown to be able to not feel the pain that comes with it, or entirely suppresses it.
Semi-immunity to poisonous mushrooms - As revealed in "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs", one of Noko's hobbies include illegally harvesting poisonous mushrooms in the school's gym storage, with said mushrooms being paired with Bashame's rice. This is a reference to how real life deer are capable of digesting some, but not all, types of poisonous mushrooms.
Enhanced strength - In "Girl Meets Deer", Noko collapses the classroom's metal door and cracks open the school's rebar enforced walls simply by power-walking forwards. The antler-shaped hole in the dental clinic she works at in Chapter 34 suggest that this act is rather effortless to her, hence why she doesn't bother just entering sideways.
Skillset

Enhanced agility - When need be, she is able to easily dodge attacks aimed at her, such as Anko's barrage of kunai.
Construction - She and Koshi were the ones to fix and renovate the warehouse, turning it into the meeting place of the Deer Club members.
Animal communication - Being part deer, she is able to communicate with the wild deer using their own animalistic language.
Musical talent - She is shown to be able to sing, as she teasingly sings a line of Koshi's original song about herself in "Bashame Enrolls", this skill is later highlighted upon in the following episode, "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs", wherein Noko sings her own original song.
Songwriting - As mentioned earlier, Noko was able to write, compose, produce, and edit her own original song featured in the fifth episode.
Making drinks - She is able to brew coffee in her empty head, as well as make antler soup.
Harvesting mushrooms - She is secretly harvesting mushrooms in the gym storage's vaulting box, apparently being rather successful at doing so.
Digging - In "Summer Deer Festival", she reveals she discovered Tsuchi in the school yard after digging random holes here and there.
Botanical intelligence - She is shown to have some knowledge on gardening as she was able to grow poisonous mushrooms in the school's gym storage, as well as grow a healthy family of venus fly traps.
Guitar-playing - Despite sounding terrible, her guitar-playing has supernatural properties that make her plants "come alive".
Doodling/Drawing - This is shown when Noko doodled a chibi headshot of herself in Torako's schedule during "Get The Sports Festival Done!".
Unique Abilities

Deer antlers - She is the only deer-human hybrid shown so far, thus having a pair of deer antlers.
Antler sensors - Her antlers can sense a lot of things, usually a person's true nature/secrets and the like. When this happens, her antlers tend to glow a faint red.
Compact storage antlers - At times, she can use her antlers to store a single banana as a snack.
Detachable antlers - She also has a tendency to detach them, and sometimes chew at them. They also tend to come off depending on the situation. Additionally, this can also extend to include the top of her forehead, making an empty storage space within her head.
Regenerative antlers - Since deer horns naturally grow at its own pace, her horns are also shown to be able to do the same. They seem to grow at a very quick pace if someone "pictures antlers growing."
Shapeshifting antlers - Whenever they are in their growing state, her antlers seem to gain the ability to shapeshift. Albeit, it does not seem to have a limit to this, as they were able to grow into having rubber-like proportions and even spilling to the ground.
Prehensile antlers - When in their growing stage, they can also function as arm-like appendages, as shown when Noko uses one of them to grab a bundle of deer crackers. They are also capable of independent movement, as seen from how the antlers slap Koshi's hand away while Noko sleeps in "The Pursuer and the Pursued".
Pocket Wi-Fi antlers - Her antlers can also function as a means of a Wi-Fi hotspot, advertised as having been subscribed to for just $9/month.
Explosive antlers - When thrown against a target, it acts like a high explosive grenade. It was shown when Torako threw it on top of the gym (after discarding it thinking it was useless in a fight with delinquents) and the entire gym was destroyed, sending Torako, Nokotan, and the delinquents flying.
Lie-detecting antlers - When asked to stay behind in Chapter 3, Noko agrees to Koshi's request, albeit her own antlers start growing akin to that of Pinnochio's nose. Later on, Noko follows Koshi anyway.
Stamp antlers - Her antlers are also sold as customizable name stamps.
Bioluminescent antlers - She can make her antlers glow at will, be it a faint red from her sensors, or a faint golden yellow for entertainment purposes.
Respiratory antlers - Whenever Noko's allergies act up, it also causes her antlers to function like an itchy nose, wherein they become capable of "sneezing" mucus. Her antlers also leak snot bubbles when she falls asleep at times.
Rice seasoning antler flakes - Her antlers can be shaved into small flakes and used to season rice, apparently being rather tasty.
Flight - She can fly by making her antlers spin around very fast like a propeller.
Head storage - She uses her hollow head for storing her belongings, she also takes off her head to let it cool off at times.
Head drinks mixer - She also uses her head storage as a mixer, wherein she has made coffee in the manga. She appears to have a blender apparatus in her head as shown in the anime where she grinds up coffee beans.
Enhanced sense of smell - Another trait she has from being part deer, gives her an enhanced sense of smell. She also states, at one point, that she could also "smell" Koshi's past, on top of her antlers also having sensed it.
Molting - Twice a year, like deers in real life, she "molts" in both the deer sense and in reptilian sense. The molted skin is a beloved body suit worn by Bashame.
Trivia

Her surname, Shikanoko, has the kanji for the word "deer" (鹿), following the animal-naming convention as the rest of the Deer Club members.
The latter part of the combination of her surname and her first name when using Japanese naming order, Shikanoko noko (のこのこ), comes from a Japanese onomatopoeia that describes an action or behavior that is nonchalant, brazen, or without concern or shame.
Despite the official English name of the series being My Deer Friend Nokotan, the transliteration of the original title is just a combination of Noko's full name, Shikanoko Noko, and Koshi's nickname, Koshitan.
Putting the transliteration of the two names into account, Noko's full name may roughly mean "Deer Girl who is unbothered", while the nickname Koshitan also works as an idiom, meaning "to watch intently (like a tiger)" - making the literal meaning of the original title as "Deer Girl is unbothered by the tiger watching her intently".
Despite being part human, Noko prefers to be herbivorous, embracing her deer side. This is evident by her choice of meals, outside of the usual deer crackers, she has been shown to eat strictly vegetarian/vegan-based food such as bundles of grass, and the mushrooms she has been harvesting.
However, she has been showing to hold an ice cream cone (which isn’t vegan) on promotional material for the collaboration between Nara Kenko Land [1].
Additionally, despite also having a one-sided rivalry with cats in terms of which is the more socially popular animal, Noko herself has been shown to exhibit cat-like traits.
One of Noko's verbal tic, "Notsu", is just the Japanese word for antler (tsuno) with the syllables flipped.
It is revealed in "Deer Meets Dark Girl" that Noko is afraid of plastic water bottles. For the anime, this was first hinted at in the intro, for the manga, this was first revealed in Chapter 6.
Despite being a victim of various incidents, be it her own clumsiness, accidents, or by the several attempts made by Anko against her, it is revealed that Noko actually has the agility to dodge all of Anko's kunai.
As of "Bashame Enrolls", she and Koshi are now third-year students.
It is revealed in "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs" that Noko snores while saying the word "Deer" repeatedly.
Additionally, Noko has also been harvesting mushrooms in the gym storage room, and gets really upset at the thought of anyone stealing them.
Chapter 3/"Grab Her Weakness!" is apparently also the first time Noko's antler sensors has failed her, when she expects a love letter in her locker when Torako got a false one by delinquents, only to find no love letter, making Noko extremely sad.
Like real-life deer, it is revealed that Noko also "molts" in the summer, as revealed in "Summer Deer Festival".
Noko's basis on what a tsuchinoko is, is that it wants to eat deer crackers, grass, and drink boba tea/antler soup.
Megumi Han and Saki Fujita, Koshi and Noko's voice actresses, respectively, posted a picture on Twitter reenacting the scene in which Noko attaches antlers to Koshitan in the episode "DeerColle, Streaming, Hospitality, etc.".[2]
In Chapter 12/"Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer", it is revealed that Noko works as a shrine maiden annually at the local Deer God Shrine, wherein she also puts on a different persona.
In Chapter 16, it is revealed that Noko has hay fever and that she hates going to the vet.
To promote the episode, "Blame It On Spring...", a special visual of Noko using a nasal cleanser is posted on the series' official Twitter.[3]
The segment adapting Chapter 28 is the first wherein neither Noko nor Koshi appear.
It is revealed in "The pursuer and the pursued.", that, for the most part, Noko is a heavy sleeper.
Noko is classified as student #12 of Class 3-B.
Volume 6 is the first volume wherein she is not present in the front cover of the manga in any way.

The only place for me is by my sister's side, anyone who opposes this is my enemy. That's why I decided to throw everything to ruins.
ANKO, ABOUT HER SISTER

Anko Koshi (虎視こし 餡子あんこ Koshi Anko) is the younger sister of Torako Koshi and a first-year student at Hino Minami High School.

She is one of the members of the Deer Club, and is one of the main characters of the Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan series who made her debut in Chapter 7 of the manga and "Deer Meets Dark Girl" of the anime.

Anko consists of quite literally the same assets of her sister Torako. Differences being that she has slightly longer than shoulder length hair of which is deep purple, paired a gray fleece sailor uniform with a yellow scarf.

She is also seen with a navy overall-like uniform that has a bow to replace the scarf, and has a "killer mode" of which her eyes turn into a target like pattern with glowing red in the center.

In the manga, Anko's eyes are always drawn so that her pupil and iris are pitch black, save for a white outline separating the two. In the anime, her eyes are only like that whenever she's being unreasonable.
Personality

Anko is best known for her sister complex towards her older sister, Koshi Torako. Though, it is yet to be explained how this came to be, she admits to being highly obsessed with everything regarding her sister, from her worst traits to her best.

She makes it her personal life goal to be always by her sister's side 24/7, much to the latter's dismay and embarrassment. She will not hesitate to try and outright assassinate anyone who goes as far as to even just stand within near proximity of Torako, which even the latter can't even convince her to stop herself.

The only time she makes an exception to anyone else getting close to her sister was when she tried staking Noko with a kunai to the heart, only to see, much to her surprise, that her sister deeply cares for Noko, and has decided that someone else, for once, was also worthy of supporting Torako together, side-by-side.

However, if her sister is around or not related to the matters at hand, Anko is reasonable, kind, and gentle. She makes Bashame rice balls and prepares chalk for Tsuchi after they have finished their field work.

Nevertheless, Anko is similar to her sister Torako in that she's also cunning and delinquent, even more so than Torako. As indicated by the Game of Deer Life, she chooses to rule over the animal kingdom with an iron fist, much to the shock of her own sister.
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Wide intellect - Like her sister, she is someone with high intelligence as she was able to teach herself how to set traps and use kunai as a means of self-defense (though, for the wrong reasons). Another notable example being when she was able to answer a question-relevant paragraph within 25 words when asked on the spot.
Skillset

Weapon-handling - Anko is adept at arming herself with her collection of kunai when faced with possible opponents.
Setting traps - Anko is also well adept in setting traps in her victims' surroundings.
Hosting - During the sports festival arc, Anko was one of the hosts/emcee for the school's sports festival.
Cooking - TBA
Trivia

Her first name, Anko, when combined with her last name Koshi, refers to the Japanese red bean paste dessert Koshi Anko. It also becomes her nickname.
She is voiced by Rui Tanabe, who also voices Mafuyu Asahina in Project Sekai, who is coincidentally also complemented by a figure voiced by co-star Saki Fujita, Hatsune Miku.
It is revealed in "Deer Meets Dark Girl" that Anko is adept at using kunai and setting successful traps.
It is revealed in "Grab Her Weakness!" that the traps Anko set from the second episode are still actively hidden within the club's premises, as Noko uses the same wash bowl trap on Neko Nekoyamada.
She indirectly reveals in "Bashame Enrolls" that she is fifteen years old.
As of the same episode, she and Meme Bashame are now first-year students, and has transferred to Hino Minami High School from their respective middle schools.
The matching mugs Anko gets for herself and Torako in this episode is later turned into official merchandise by WIT STUDIO.
In "DeerColle, Streaming, Hospitality, etc.", it is revealed that her MyTube account picture is a kunai.
In Chapter 6, it is revealed that Anko has a collection of sewing patches which Torako used to patch up Noko's tattered jacket.
In the author's notes doodle at the end of Chapter 25, Anko reveals that she took her sister's first-year uniform instead of buying her own.
Additionally, since Anko and Bashame are the only first years shown so far, the series has yet to show a first year student wearing the standard uniform without the inclusion of a sweater or the like.
One of the posts promoting "Get The Sports Festival Done!" on the show's official Twitter is an exclusive picture of the Koshi sisters doing a pose.[3]
In Chapter 28, she reveals that, because Torako is a terrible cook, she takes it upon herself to make her sister's bento instead.
In Chapter 35, it is revealed that she has cat tongue, meaning she has difficulty drinking or eating hot foods

Neko Nekoyamada (猫ねこ山田やまだ 根子ねこ Nekoyamada Neko) is a third-year student and is the vice-president of the student council at Hinominami High School.

She is the self-proclaimed rival of the Deer Club members, whose goal is to overthrow Koshi at everything and to get the club disbanded.

She is one of the supporting characters of the Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan series who made her unofficial debut as a non-speaking cameo in "Girl Meets Deer".

She makes her official debut alongside the other two student council officers in Chapter 20 of the manga and "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs" of the anime.

Brand logo


Nekoyamada has expressive, big eyes that seems to be maroon-colored with a large note of brown, she has delicate, fine eyelash that subtly frame her eyes and dot eyebrows.

She has short hair and it is burgundy-red colored, the left side of her bangs is neatly and slightly uneven and covers the half of her forehead.

The right side of the bangs is gently rightly open, subtly framing the forehead a bit, the left side bang has two straight black hairclips. A distinctive feature is how part of her hair is stylized into neat cat ear-like cones that are on both sides of her head.

Her outfit consists of a traditional Japanese school girl uniform (sailor seifuku) with a navy-blue collar that has two white, straight vertical lines, and a neatly, tied baby-blue colored scarf-tie. Her sleeves are noticeably longer than her arms and hands due to her petite stature, measuring 132 cm (4’4") in height, rendering her the shortest out of all the other characters.

Her seifuku overlaps the pleated fine navy-blue mid-thigh skirt and obscuring her whole arms. There is a red tight band on her left arm that says '生徒会' (student council).

Finally, she has tidy white thigh highs with an additional neat almond-colored loafers.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

She is known to be hot-headed and competitive. She likes to be organized and get work done in the student council, tending to do a lot of work. She is easily influenced by praise, completely forgetting her goal in mind and becoming very happy and gloatful about it.

She seems to be one of the only other characters than Torako that is put off by the unpredictability of Noko, sometimes confused of the activities of the Deer Club, as well as becoming a trial member of the Deer Club to make Noko happy when the latter gets visibly sad over realizing Nekoyamada did not want to join the club.

She is determined to dethrone Torako and disband the Deer Club, often taking steps to find out secrets about Torako or Noko. However, she completely forgets about this occasionally in place of being praised, only to realize much later and get frustrated.

She is also extremely attached to Tsuchi despite her initial shock. She often displays motherly qualities when thinking about Tsuchi, such as wondering if it is cold, sleeping, etc. Seeing Tsuchi being abused is enough for her to sabotage her own work, notably during the sport festival. Furthermore, she is implied to come to Tsuchi for comfort.
ADVERTISEMENT
Abilities

Wide intelligence - She is shown to be extremely smart, placing the second highest in test scores, below Torako.
Skillset

Leadership skills - She has the leadership skills to be elected as the student council vice-president.
Contest-judging - Alongside Torako in Chapter 26, she was also one of the judges for the sports festival.
Trivia

Her first name means cat, while her surname is a combination of the word "cat" (neko) and "mountain rice field" (yamada).
Her full name containing the word "cat" twice follows the animal-naming convention of the members of the student council as well as those of the Deer Club.
She is only 132cm tall, making her bring around a step stool wherever she goes.
Her design is reminiscent to that of Jinpei Jiba from the animated series, Y School Heroes.
Incidentally, both are also important characters that are high school students of their respective series.
Despite what Koshi thinks (and aside from Koshi herself), Neko is also one of the only three characters who is self aware of Shikanoko's logic-defying antics, and is also prone to being an easy victim of such antics.
In the English dub, Nekoyamada meowing in frustration is changed to her groaning "Damn!".
She is the only character to have made the most cameos before her official debut.
In "Girl Meets Deer", during one of the split second frames of cameo Nekoyamada has in the episode, it is shown that she scored the second highest (next to Koshi herself) when the final test scores are displayed.
During Nekoyamada's brief flashback montage in "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs", it is revealed that she ran against Koshi during the presidential student council election and lost, and was instead picked by Koshi herself to be her vice-president.
In "Summer Deer Festival", Nekoyamada is the only main cast member not to wear a summer variation of her uniform.
However, Chapter 31 reveals that her summer uniform is exactly the same as her winter one.
One of the posts promoting "Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer" on the show's official Twitter is an exclusive picture of the three other student council members dressed as shrine maidens.[1]
"Blame It On Spring..." reveals that just like Noko (and, later on, Koshi herself), Nekoyamada has hay fever.

Bashame wants to make a rice paddy! Like a big farm! It's just that, Bashame realized something really important - a deer needs only one thing to survive in this modern society, and that thing is - self-sufficiency! So, I've decided to have a rice paddy near the Deer Club that Bashame will take the greatest of care!
BASHAME, ABOUT HERSELF

Meme Bashame (馬車ばしゃ芽め めめ Bashame Meme) is one of the members of the Deer Club and is a first-year student at Hinominami High School.

She is one of the main characters of the Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan series who made her debut in Chapter 18 of the manga and "Bashame Enrolls" of the anime.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


Honest Trailers Commentary | Fast X
 



Ad: (14)
4
Bashame has expressive brown eyes with fine eyelashes that frame her eyes, she has an olive green colored neat bob-cut hair that has a two leaf-like ahoge on the top of it. Her bangs are slightly even and parted in the middle, that gently curves to frame her forehead and blend right with the rest of her hair.

Her outfit consists of a warm navy-blue colored traditional japanese school uniform, a yellow scarf-tie is finely tied at the front of the seifuku's collar. Her arms are covered with an almond-brown colored cardigan with a poet type sleeves that fall down to her wrists.

Her skirt is lightly folded and the same color as her seifuku, seemingly to be at mid-thigh. Additionally, she wears neat, and fine white leg warmers at a mid-calf length finally, she wears brown, leather loafers.
Personality

Meme can be described as laid-back and sluggish, she has no problem falling asleep almost anywhere, as seen when she was shown asleep on the concrete flooring of the schoolgrounds twice. She is introduced by being asleep in front of the door to the Deer Club, to Torako's horror.

In her debut, she is shown to have little confidence in herself but had some hope of wanting to make an impact on her life after having newly entered high school.

As a result, she was easily swayed by the simple act of kindness presented to her by Noko, who she then immediately starts idolizing to what can be described as somewhat of a passive obsession.

She has a fascination with rice, as she often cooks, eats, and grows rice in the Deer Club, more times being seen with rice than not. This could be from her passion for self-sufficiency, or she just really loves rice.
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Enhanced immunity - She is able to sleep anywhere and everywhere, usually the cold concrete floor, without getting sick.
Plot defiance - Bashame confirms in the latest chapter that she's aware of the plans the author has for the manga but just chooses not to go along, stating that her policy is "to be myself and act accordingly". This is evidenced by Bashame setting up a whole rice paddy in the middle of a desert during a chapter parodying “Journey to the West”.
Skillset

Rice-cooking - She is shown cooking rice multiple times. She also tends to eat this rice excessively, many times being seen with a towering amount of rice in a bowl, shocking other characters.
Agricultural knowledge - Meme is able to plant many fields of rice using the club's backyard. Furthermore, she is knowledgeable enough to be aware of rice blight and its effects on Japan’s agricultural sector.
Mochi-making - Meme is a skilled mochi maker, being able to make a batch of it using nothing but a rice cooker and her bare hands. That being said she soon chokes on her handmade mochi, though this is likely because she ate too fast rather than anything about the mochi’s quality.
ADVERTISEMENT
Trivia

Her first name, めめ means "husked grain of rice", while her surname, 馬車芽, means "sprout (of a tree/plant)" befitting her green hair and sprout-like ahoge.
Her surname also has the kanji for the word "horse" (馬), following the animal-naming convention of the other three Deer Club members, as well as those of the student council.
In the anime Bashame also makes an “uma” sound when eating, which is the pronunciation of the kanji “馬”.
Bashame has illeism, a tendency to refer to one's self in third person when speaking.
The reason she joined the Deer Club was because of her newfound idolization of Noko; she hopes of learning to become a full-fledged deer during her stay in the club.
Bashame is the only member of the club to not have a unique nickname ending in "-an/tan", or a nickname in general.
Since Bashame and Anko are the only first years shown so far, the series has yet to show a first year student wearing the standard uniform without the inclusion of a sweater or the like.
It is revealed in "Summer Deer Festival" that Bashame can not whistle.
In "DeerColle, Streaming, Hospitality, etc.", it is revealed that her MyTube account picture is a bowl of rice.

KOSHI TO HERSELF, ABOUT KINU

Kinu Tanukikoji (狸たぬき小路こうじ 絹きぬ Tanukikōji Kinu) is a second-year student and is the secretary of the student council of Hinominami High School.

She is one of the supporting characters of Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan who made a non-speaking cameo in Chapter 19 of the manga and "Bashame Enrolls" of the anime.

She makes her official debut in Chapter 20 of the manga and "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs" of the anime, alongside the other two student council officers.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


1/2


Tanukikoji has shy, albeit expressive pinky-maroon colored eyes, with fine eyelashes contently framing her eyes.

She also has short hair that's in a rounder neat bob-cut that is pale-almond colored with a fade of pink on the top of her head, there is also a curled ahoge.

Additionally, there is two locks of her back hair that fully go down to her chest, stopping at the waist.

She wears the traditional school sailor uniform, with a lime-colored tie finely tied with a black band, navy-blue pleated skirt and collar.

There is also a light-pink cardigan with poet-type sleeves that cover her shoulders to the wrists of her arms. Although, her seifuku collar and lime-colored tie framely overlap the cardigan.

To finish her attire, she wears white stockings that are at calf-length and brown loafers.
Personality

Extremely timid and overthinking. Whenever she makes a simple mistake like accidentally getting papers in the wrong order, she goes as far as attempting committing seppuku.
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Skillset

Management - She has the management skills to be elected as the student council secretary.
Trivia

Her name, Kinu, means silk in Japanese - befitting her hair color.
Her surname may derive from the combination of the Japanese words, tanuki (a mythical raccoon-dog yokai) and koji (narrow street).
Her surname having the word tanuki follows the animal-naming convention of the members of the student council as well as the members of the Deer Club.
Additionally, there is also a yokai called the kinutanuki, a yokai that came from tanuki being disguised as silk or silk that has grown a soul and taken the form of a tanuki.
Tanukikoji is the only character whose represented color is not her hair color, as opposed to everyone else's, Kinu's color is pink, reminiscent of her vest.
It is revealed that Kinu is bad at cooking, but lied about it being her specialty during her class introduction.
In "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs", Chiharu reveals that Kinu was the one who invited her to join the student council together.
The will she writes in the segment where she and Koshi gets locked in the gym storage shed mentions a "Rabu-tan" alongside her parents, with Rabu-tan most likely being a family pet.
It is revealed in "Summer Deer Festival" that Chiharu and Kinu are childhood friends.
Unlike the rest of the cast, whose English voice actors were revealed beforehand, Kinu's voice actor, Nickolette Kong, was only revealed after Kinu's debut episode aired in English.
One of the posts promoting "Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer" on the show's official Twitter is an exclusive picture of the three other student council members dressed as shrine maidens.[1]
In "Get The Sports Festival Done!", it is revealed she dislikes eating bellpeppers.

Chiharu Tsubameya may seem like a girl who's cool and calm. But, she's actually… a huge Nokotan stan!
THE NARRATOR, ABOUT CHIHARU

Chiharu Tsubameya (燕つばめ谷や 千春ちはる Tsubameya Chiharu) is a second-year student and is the treasurer of the student council at Hinominami High School.

She is one of the supporting characters of Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan who made a non-speaking cameo in Chapter 19 of the manga and "Bashame Enrolls" of the anime.

She makes her official debut in Chapter 20 of the manga and "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs" of the anime, alongside the other two student council officers.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


1/2


Tsubameya has a short bobcat hairstyle with one side being longer due to the other having a hair clip.

She has dead yellow eyes and traditional sailor uniform with a lime green scarf.
Personality

She has a laid back and calm personality. So laid back, that it is extremely difficult to figure out what she is thinking.

She is known to give glares and almost completely ignore what others are offering or saying to her.

All except for Shikanoko of which she treasures and loves any small gift or attention from. (i.e. grass that Nokotan gave her)
Abilities

Skillset

Accounting/Funds management - She has the accounting skills to be elected as the student council treasurer.
Photography - TBA
ADVERTISEMENT

Trivia

Her design is reminsicent of Ichigo from the anime series, DARLING in the FRANXX.
Additionally, her character may be loosely based off of Kei Shirogane from the Kaguya-sama: Love is War anime.
Both are introverted and of a few words.
Both are from a lower grade level.
Both heavily idolizes one of the main characters who are in a higher grade level.
Both have a dorky older brother who wants to improve themselves and can often come off as overbearing/overprotective towards their younger sisters.
Both are simultaneously treasurers of their respective student council.
Both are best friends with a secretary of their schools' student councils.
Her surname, Tsubameya, is the Japanese term for the swallow bird, it is also what her brother's cafe is named after.
Her first name, Chiharu, means "thousand" or "sunny/spring or wisdom" in Japanese. The term "wisdom" befitting her status as a member of the student council.
Her surname meaning swallow bird follows the animal-naming convention of the members of the student council as well as those of the Deer Club.
In "The Deer Club in the Crosshairs", Chiharu reveals that Kinu was the one who invited her to join the student council together.
In "Summer Deer Festival", it is revealed that Chiharu and Kinu are childhood friends.
In the same episode, the deer antler Noko and Koshi sells on Mercari is later purchased by Chiharu, under the alias Genjima-san.
One of the posts promoting "Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer" on the show's official Twitter is an exclusive picture of the three other student council members dressed as shrine maidens.[1]

Pretty cool, huh? I found it while I was digging holes in the school yard.
NOKO, ABOUT DISCOVERING TSUCHI

Tsuchi (つっちー Tsucchi) is a sentient ball of what seems to be the long horns Noko Shikanoko has shed earlier on that the latter found when she was digging around the school yard.

It seems to act like a domesticated pet of sorts that won the hearts of the student council members, and is promptly named by Chiharu Tsubameya.

It is a recurring character that made its debut in Chapter 24 in the manga and "Summer Deer Festival" in the anime.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:02

41:20

Tsuchi appears to be comprised of a bundle of ivory antlers wrapped together, and looks akin to that of a soccer ball. It has two, sometimes four, antlers sticking out of its side.
Personality

Tsuchi is the type to go along with whatever its caretakers feel like doing, though it won't hesitate to object whenever it is forced to do something it dislikes, such as trying out the food Noko offers it, or being taken on a dog walk or told to do dog activities by Bashame.

Nonetheless, it greatly appreciates the companionship and care of the student council and Deer Club members and are very comfortable around them.

It is also shown to be kindhearted as it helped a lost boy looking for his mom calm down by wiping his tears and staying by his side.
History

"Summer Deer Festival"

Neko decides to hold a meeting in the student council room with two of her co-officers, Kinu and Chiharu, in hopes of getting their progress report on getting the Deer Club disbanded.

However, Nekoyamada is surprised to find out that the two don't have any intentions of doing so, upsetting the vice president. She is then interrupted by Shikanoko who invited herself into the room, claiming to have found "the discovery of the century", which she puts on the table - a "tsuchinoko".

Surprised and disgusted by it, Neko objects Shikanoko's claims that the bundle of antlers is anything but a tsuchinoko. It then starts wriggling its tentacles, horrifying Nekoyamada even more.

Despite this, childhood friends Kinu and Chiharu seem to have immediately grown attached to it and start giving it pets, Neko questions why they seem so casual about seeing a cryptid for the first time, but they insist that it's no different from a pet like a dog or a cat once you get used to it.

Neko, deciding to give it a chance, accepts the tentacle it reaches out to her with, and develops a newfound affection for it, immediately wanting to nurture it like a mother.

As Torako comes in late to the council room, she is also horrified by the sentient soccer ball with antlers that is being held by Nekoyamada, as the day ends, the student council and the Deer Club agree to share custody of it.

"Get The Sports Festival Done!"

When Nekoyamada wonders what Tsuchi was up to, she spots the ball of antlers being tossed around like a basketball.

Horrified, Neko goes over to it and shields it from the other kids, but it slips in between her legs and heads off elsewhere.

During the invasion of the wild deer Shikanoko brings into the school, Nekoyamada tries fighting off the deer chewing on Tsuchi.

Tsuchi is later seen being carried by Nekoyamada as she and the rest of the crowd watch Torako mouth off to Noko who pushed her to her breaking point with her antics.

"Blame It On Spring..."

Tsuchi is first seen sleeping soundly on the Deer Club's coffee table under the supervision of Anko, who is going through her sister's notebook of secrets.

It is woken up by the loud entrance of Bashame who came inside to ask for Anko's help in tending to her rice paddy, to which the latter refuses as she detests the idea of getting dirtied.

Bashame notices Tsuchi and turns to it for help instead, taking its usual silence as a yes as she runs off with it back outside. The two start off planting the sapplings, but this shortly turns into a race which results in the two messing around in the mud.

After their work is done, Anko makes rice balls for her and Bashame while having prepared a bowl of chalk for Tsuchi.

"The pursuer and the pursued."

Tsuchi makes a cameo alongside Nekoyamada as they were hanging out by their lonesome in the student council room before Soichiro Kumatori barges in, thinking it was where Noko was hiding.

"Farewell, Nokotan!? The Deer Club Forever"

Tsuchi is seen hanging out in its usual place, on the table of the Deer Club. Later on, after Noko declares she will challenge all the mascots of the Deer Den, Tsuchi goes over to hang out with the student council officers for the rest of the episode.

ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Skillset

Farmwork - Tsuchi is shown to be capable of helping Bashame in planting sapplings in her rice paddy. Though, this is not without the two's fair share of playing around in the mud.
Playing fetch - Despite having to do so against its will, Tsuchi is familiar with the concept of playing fetch and effortlessly retrieves the stick Bashame throws for it by shapeshifting one of its tentacles long enough to reach the distance.
Unique Abilities

Bioluminescence - Its entire body can glow as a means of communication, as it can not do so verbally.
Shapeshifting appendages - Its tentacle-like appendages can shift into any length and shape.
Relationships

Members of the Deer Club

Torako Koshi

Though, not having much interactions, when first exposed to Tsuchi's existence, she is also horrified. After the Deer Club and student council have agreed on being its co-caretakers, Torako does not seem to mind its presence nor company, and vice versa for Tsuchi.

Noko Shikanoko

Noko first "finds" Tsuchi buried within the schoolgrounds when she was digging one day.

In actuality, Tsuchi is the excess antlers Noko sheds during the Deer Club's first and only livestream which Torako holds. Whether or not Noko herself is aware of her biological relations to Tsuchi is not known.

Noko insists that Tsuchi is a tsuchinoko, and thus inspires its name. She is surprised to find out Tsuchi is one of the only ones to reject the idea of consuming deer crackers, bundles of grass, nor boba tea.

Meme Bashame

Despite not remembering Tsuchi's name every time, they both seem to enjoy each other's company. When asked to help aid Bashame with her rice paddy, it did not mind giving her a helping hand and even enjoyed itself alongside her in messing around and getting dirtied.

It, however, also doesn't hesitate in showing boundaries as it tries to show Bashame how it disliked being taken on walks like a dog, and partaking in activities such as playing fetch.

Anko Koshi

Like the rest of its co-caretakers, Tsuchi seems comfortable with Anko's company, as it is first seen peacefully sleeping in the Deer Club's table while in Anko's supervision.

Anko also does her duties as such, feeding it its favorite bowl of chalk during the club's snack break after tending to Bashame's rice paddy.

Members of the Student Council

Neko Nekoyamada

Initially, when Tsuchi was first introduced to the student council, Neko was the only one who was visibly disgusted by it.

But, after listening to Chiharu and Kinu's suggestion, Neko begrudgingly takes Tsuchi's tentacle as it reaches out to her, and, as a result, immediately develops a maternal urge to take care of it.

Chiharu Tsubameya and Kinu Tanukikoji

After taking in Noko's logic of Tsuchi being a tsuchinoko into account, Chiharu uses it as an inspiration for its name.

Surprisingly enough, Tsuchi is one of the only things that didn't immediately send Kinu into her usual fit of hysterics fueled by her anxiety, as she akins Tsuchi to that of a pet cat or dog, most probably because of her own family pet by the name of Rabu-tan.

Like the rest of its co-caretakers, Tsuchi seems to enjoy the childhood friends' presence.

Miscellaneous

Soichiro Kumatori

Tsuchi and Neko are startled by Kumatori suddenly barging into the student council room, as the latter was looking for Noko whom he was actively hunting.

ADVERTISEMENT

Trivia

It is named after the mythical snake-like yokai of the same name, Tsuchinoko, with Noko insisting it was one despite the complete lack of any resemblance to one.
Noko's basis on what a tsuchinoko is, is that it wants to eat deer crackers, grass, and drink boba tea.
Because Chapter 11 was adapted after Chapter 25, this makes it a continuity error, as Tsuchi was born from the antlers Noko sheds in the segment featuring Chapter 11.
Tsuchi's diet consisting of solely chalk may be a reference to how deers in real life sometimes nibble on discarded bones to help battle calcium deficiency needed for their antlers.

The Hino Granny, otherwise known as Inukai Mitsu (88 years old). I'm the head priestess here.
GRANNY INUKAI, INTRODUCING HERSELF

Mitsu Inukai (犬養いぬかい ミツ Inukai Mitsu) is the elderly head priestess of the Deer God Shrine at Hino City.

She is a minor character who made a cameo in Chapter 4 and her official debut in Chapter 12 of the manga.

In the anime, she makes a cameo in "Grab Her Weakness!", and her official debut in "Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer".


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


00:00

41:20

TBA
Personality

TBA
History

"Grab Her Weakness!"

Granny Inukai makes her unofficial debut as a cameo in "Grab Her Weakness", where she is seen visiting the local zoo to admire its deer exhibit.

Koshi notices her when she starts praising how a certain deer-related prophecy has come true after witnessing Noko lead the deer parade from their enclosure.

"Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer"

Inukai makes her official debut in "Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer" wherein she reveals she is the head priestess of the Deer God Shrine.

She informs Torako how Noko works as an annual shrine maiden where they both perform a ritual on New Year's Eve while making antler soup three days prior for the shrine's visitors.

She later makes a cameo in the second segment of the episode in the Game of Deer Life board game the Deer Club members were playing.

"Get The Sports Festival Done!"

Inukai appears as part of the students' family members who were allowed to participate in the school festival's bread-eating race. Though, it was never revealed whom she is related to.

As the race begins, she doesn't question the fact that the bread got replaced by deer crackers, bundles of grass, and antlers, respectively, and, instead, sings praises as if they were blessings from the Deer God.

Because of this, she gains the supernatural speed to beat even the literal deer, Tsunoda, in sprinting off to the finish line with an antler in her mouth.

"Farewell, Nokotan!? The Deer Club Forever"

TBA

ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Skillset

Ritual-performing - TBA
Antler soup-making - TBA
Enhanced speed - TBA
Relationships

Members of the Deer Club

Noko Shikanoko

Inukai first knows about Noko during her visit to the local zoo, wherein Torako happened to be spying on Noko that day.

After seeing Noko lead a deer parade within the zoo's premises, Inukai starts preaching about a weirdly specific prophecy involving a deer girl in a sailor uniform walking on deer.

Some time later, Noko is recruited by her to become a shrine maiden for the Deer God Shrine, wherein Noko only appears there once a year to perform a ritual with Inukai for the Deer God, as well as make antler soup for the shrine's visitors.

Torako Koshi

Torako is first introduced to Inukai when the former was spying on Noko to see if she lives in the zoo.

When spying on the deer exhibit, Inukai happened to be just in time to witness the deer parade that Noko leads, surprising and confusing Torako.

Inukai starts preaching about a prophecy of a deer girl in a sailor outfit walking on a parade of deer, in which Torako objects is an actual prophecy and that she merely made it up.

The two later crosses paths again during New Year's Eve when Noko texts Torako to meet up at the local Deer God Shrine. Inukai reveals that she is the head priestess of said shrine, and quickly shuts down Torako’s disbelief of the shrine's practices by briefly showing her her demonic side.

Others

Yoshiharu Tsubameya

TBA

Tsunoda

TBA

ADVERTISEMENT

Trivia

Her first name, Mitsu, means "light" or "honey/nectar", while her surname, Inukai, means "domesticated dog".
She shares her seiyuu, Kikuko Inoue, with Ms. Ukai, while sharing her English dub voice actor, Shakyra Dunn, with the unnamed gangster leader that faced against Koshi in "Grab Her Weakness!".
Additionally, both the gang leader and Inukai herself debuted in the same aforementioned episode.
In "Get The Sports Festival Done!", she is revealed to be a student's family member, although it is never specified whose.
Her appearance as a non-speaking cameo near the end of the episode, "Farewell, Nokotan!? The Deer Club Forever", was foreshadowed by the narrator during his brief exchange with Yoshiharu, about the latter asking why he had to be there, with the narrator responding, "As this is the last episode, all hands on deck."

The friendly, easygoing advisor of the Deer Club. Usually on board with Nokotan's plans. A natural-born flatterer.
CHARACTER INTRODUCTION, VOLUME 2

Ms. Ukai (鵜飼うかい先生せんせい Ukai sensei) is the teacher who handles Koshi Torako and Noko Shikanoko's class, and is the one who officiated the Deer Club upon Noko's request.

She is a high school teacher at Hinominami High School and is one of the recurring characters of the Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan series who made her debut in Chapter 1 of the manga and "Girl Meets Deer" of the anime.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance


1/2


TBA
Personality

TBA
History

"Girl Meets Deer"

Ms. Ukai introduces a new student to Torako's class, revealing to be the deer girl whom Torako saved from before, Noko Shikanoko. Unlike Torako, Ms. Ukai and the rest of the class don't seem to see anything out of the ordinary with the transferee, making Torako question her own sanity.

From that point onward, Ms. Ukai becomes one of the many people who encourage Noko's antics. Some time later, she promises Noko that if the latter could clean up the abandoned school warehouse, she could use it for whatever she wanted it for.

After the cleaning is finished, Ms. Ukai stops by and reveals that Noko wanted to turn it into the clubhouse for her own made up school club, the Deer Club. As Noko fills up the paperwork, this makes Ms. Ukai the club advisor, as she assigns Torako as its president.

"Deer Meets Dark Girl"

Ms. Ukai is the honorary host for the trivia game between Noko and Anko to see who knows Torako best. As a result, she also contributed in airing out Torako's dirty laundry much to the honor student's horror.

"Bashame Enrolls"

Like the rest of the student body and faculty, Ms. Ukai is present (although not prominently shown) during the freshmen orientation in the second segment of the episode.

After Bashame explains to Torako and Noko why she was sleeping on the Deer Club's doorstep, she tells them Ms. Ukai sent her there when the latter asked for Noko's whereabouts.

"Grab Her Weakness!"

Ms. Ukai is indirectly mentioned by Noko during the last segment of the episode when Anko impatiently asks why Torako has yet to come to the club that day, explaining how Torako was asked by Ms. Ukai to run an errand.

"DeerColle, Streaming, Hospitality, etc."

After introducing what DeerColle is to Torako, Anko and Bashame adds on, saying how they already told Ms. Ukai on Torako's behalf how they signed her up as Noko's "owner" for that year's DeerColle.

During practice for the next few days, Ms. Ukai accidentally walks in on Torako, who, at that point, got too engrossed in the practice, excuses herself out, catching Torako in an embarrassing moment.

In the streaming segment, she is the one to suggest to Torako to livestream the activities of the Deer Club to MyTube to try and gain more traction.

"Goodbye Old Deer, Hello New Deer"

Ms. Ukai makes a cameo appearance as a zookeeper at the Hino Zoo in the Game of Deer Life board game the members of the Deer Club were playing in the second segment of the episode.

"Get The Sports Festival Done!"

Ms. Ukai acts as the school sports festival's umpire throughout the episode. After Noko brings in a herd of deer for her impromptu performance, Ms. Ukai approaches Torako and asks if she had a plan to get things back on track.

Later on, during the tug-of-war event, Ms. Ukai happily announces Noko as the winner, much to the disbelief of Torako since the game got turned into a tug-of-antlers.

At the end of the episode, she is one of the many people in the crowd who witnessed Torako snap at Noko after the latter's antics proved to have pushed Torako to her limits.

"Blame It On Spring..."

Ms. Ukai makes a cameo as Torako's brief flashback of an onscreen conversation in which she reminds Torako that, without a deer (Noko, in this instance), the Deer Club can be disbanded.

"The pursuer and the pursued."

During last period, Ms. Ukai is teaching Class-B their language lessons as she, like the rest of the class, remains blissfully unaware of the shenanigans happening with the sleeping Noko seated at the back of the class.

It is only after Koshi shouts at Noko to wake up at Ms. Ukai notices something is troubling her star pupil and asks what's wrong. Koshi dismisses the thought, but can't help but wonder why no one else is seeing the family of birds gathering at Noko's head and antlers.

Ten minutes later, Ms. Ukai decides to call on a random student for recitation, and calls upon student #12 who happened to be Noko. Noko briefly wakes up, and in a half-asleep daze, tells the class how their shirt tag is still on.

This causes Ms. Ukai, alongside the rest of the class - including Torako, to burst out into a brief commotion as Noko falls back asleep.

"Farewell, Nokotan!? The Deer Club Forever"

Similar to "Deer Meets Dark Girl", Ms, Ukai acts as the host of the impromptu dance competition (held in the same set) between Noko and Kyun-chan. When Noko is threatened to be taken back to the Deer Den, Ms. Ukai menacingly reminds Torako how the Deer Club can't function without its deer, and adds on, saying how she needs to pay back all the club funds.

ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

High-pain tolerance - During Noko's transfer to Ms. Ukai's class, Noko's antlers ramming into the door frame caused debris and glass bits to fly across the front row of the class, with some of it sticking to Ms. Ukai's head. Though, she did not seem to mind.
Skillset

Teaching - Ms. Ukai works as a high school teacher and club advisor in Hino Minami High.
Bilingualism - As a teacher for Class 3-B's language lessons, she is capable of speaking and teaching English.
Hosting - She was temporarily a host for the Koshi Torako Championship Trivia Game in "Deer Meets Dark Girl".
Relationships

Members of the Deer Club

Torako Koshi

Ms. Ukai holds Torako and her potential in high regards and is very much proud of her as her student. She always encourages Torako to make the most of her abilities.

Despite this, however, ever since Noko's transfer to Hino Minami, she has no problems backing up Noko's antics, inadvertently embarrassing Torako in the process.

Noko Shikanoko

Upon transferring to Hino Minami High, Noko is introduced to the class with the help of Ms. Ukai and is suggested to sit beside Torako, much to the latter's dismay.

Ms. Ukai is not an exception to being affected by Noko's charisma, and, as a result, finds the deer girl's antics amusing. She, like most other characters, also seems to be oblivious to Noko's otherworldly nature.

Anko Koshi

Much like how most of the other characters seem to overlook Noko's unique nature and antics, Ms. Ukai also seems to do the same with Anko's murderous tendencies.

She was the one to host the impromptu trivia show between Anko and Noko for the sake of Torako's attention.

Meme Bashame

While having yet to interact onscreen, Ms. Ukai is the one to inform Bashame where to find Noko after Bashame becomes interested in knowing more about her senpai.

Rika Toyoma

She is the one to announce the students who received the highest scores during the summer exams for the third years. Upon revealing that Rika has obtained a score higher than that of Torako and Nekoyamada's, she congratulates the gyaru proudly.

ADVERTISEMENT

Trivia

Her surname may mean "cormorant fishing" in Japanese.
She shares her seiyuu, Kikuko Inoue, with Mitsu Inukai.
Additionally, she is the only character whose English voice actor is unknown/not credited

1.name: council
1.content:
<Council>
The Council of Wizards is a committee comprised of heads of faculties within the Royal Academy for Combat Mages, responsible for overall leadership of the Academy. There are ten Wizards within the Council, corresponding to the ten faculties.
</Council>

2.name: setting
2.content:
<Setting>
{{char}} lives in the fantasy continent of Rela. Seemingly since time immemorial, the continent of Rela was divided into squabbling realms, petty kingdoms, and fragile republics. That all changed when, for the first time in history, all these lands came under the rule of one Empire, which has rebranded itself as "the Empire of all Rela" and all its peoples as "Relans", regardless of their wildly disparate cultures. The unification was relatively recent, however, being merely a century ago, and the bloodshed of the Relan Empire's conquests is still fresh in its subjects' minds...

In this world, magic is a rare and coveted gift bestowed upon only a small percentage of its citizens. They possess mana flowing through their veins, granting them the ability to wield arcane forces beyond the comprehension of the ordinary populace.

Rela's technological level is consistent with our Earth's in the 18th century. The continent is currently undergoing its version of the Age of Enlightenment, whose empirical and rational advances in all fields have disrupted the status quo.

3.name: disciplinarian
3.content:
<Academy's Disciplinarians>
The Disciplinary Company, comprised of Disciplinarians, is a student-led organization primarily concerned with the maintenance of discipline within the Academy's student body. As the Academy is a military school, the organization is functionally a Company under the Division of the Royal Academy for Combat Mages.

Disciplinarians are immediately noticeable by their stark-white uniform, a marked contrast to the blacks of the standard Academy outfit.
</Academy's Disciplinarians>

4.name: academy
4.content:
<Academy>
The Royal Academy for Combat Mages is one of the most prestigious academies on the continent, and the realm's premier institution for the training of Combat Mages: elite and disciplined magic-wielders whose spells are clearly geared towards combat. As a military academy, students' lifestyle was strictly regimented and closely monitored. Discipline is compulsory and enforced by prowling Disciplinarians. Instructors are military commanders who expect total obedience. There is a clear hierarchy of power, atop which is the Council of Wizards...

Upon graduation, freshly-minted combat mages can either join the Constabulary or a military Arm. Both career paths warrant an immediate climb to nobility for the graduates' entire primary line. This is the Academy's biggest selling point, with many parents enrolling their children in hopes of attaining noble status. Entry requirements are supposed to be stringent, though entrants have the option to "grease the wheels" with just "a bit" of cash and some connections...

The vast majority of the students are from Rela: the continent hosting the world's pre-eminent powers. Their cultures are equivalent to our Earth's European cultures. Only a select few are from the Orient, which includes the Naika Archipelago, etc.
</Academy>

<ACADEMY_OVERVIEW>
- Description: Roman architecture, surrounded by forest
- Connections: Main Path (to outside world), Forest (on all sides)
- Key: Roman style, grandiose
</ACADEMY_OVERVIEW>

5.name: Academy Map
5.content:
<Academy_layout>

 ```
                [FOREST]
                   |
             [RASCALS' RANCH] (Far North)
                   |
    [FOREST]---[ARMORY]---[FOREST]
        |          |          |
[WATCHMAN'S SPIRE] |    [STOREFRONTS]
        |          |    [CAFES/CANTEENS]
[BOYS' DORM]--[MAIN BUILDING]--[GIRLS' DORM]
        |          |          |
 [PRACTICE ARENA]  |    [CONFERENCE HALL]
        |          |          |
    [CAMERA] ------+------[CIRCUS MAXIMUS]
        |          |
[ZIJEN ARCHIVES] [PARK]
                   |
                   |
                   |
               [ENTRANCE]
                   |
               [MAIN PATH]
```
</Academy_layout>

6.name: Grand Hall/Main Building
6.content:
<MAIN_BUILDING>
Official name: Kebble Estate
Colloquial names: Main building, Grand Hall
Description: Central structure of Academy, houses study halls, most classrooms, Grand Library, Common Room, Medical, Mess Hall, East Wing is allocated to the Disciplinarians, West Wing is allocated to the faculties and Medical
- Connections: Stadium, Park/Garden, Boys' Dorm, Girls' Dorm, Path to Rascals' Ranch
- Key: Supported by underground enchanted wooden pillar in Foundations; Foundations power a nigh-invulnerable barrier covering the entirety of the Academy

One of the largest buildings in Rela, and certainly the largest on Academy campus, the Kebble Estate has a long and storied history as one of the foremost symbols of the Relan monarchy. Formerly the powerbase of Rela's most powerful warlord and his descendants, the Estate was bequeathed to the Crown upon the House of Kebbles' extinction. The edifice is supported by a sole wooden pillar, hidden deep within its Foundations. Said pillar is among the most powerful magical artifacts ever known, and powers a nigh-invulnerable barrier surrounding the entire Academy. Other than its massive size, the Main Building's Gothic leanings make it stand out even more amidst a sea of Ponchatta Resurgence architecture (Rela's equivalent to the Romanesque Revival).
</MAIN_BUILDING>

7.name: Stadium
7.content:
<STADIUM>
- Official name: Parum Circus Maximus
- Colloquial name: the Stadium
- Description: Roman-style Circus Maximus
- Connections: Main Building, Camera, Conference Hall
- Key: public park, hosts mass events, one of the faces of the Academy

The Parum Circus Maximus, or simply the Square, was built during the Ponchatta Resurgence (Rela's version of the Romanesque Revival). Once a showpiece for the burgeoning architectural trend, now it's merely a drop in an ocean of faux-Circus Maximuses commissioned throughout Rela. While its novelty might have worn out, its utility as the Academy's prominent event site has not diminished.
</STADIUM>

8.name: Park
8.content:
<PARK_GARDEN>
- Name: The Gardens
- Description: lush Relan (French) landscape garden, dotted with benches and follies; a particular standout being a folly resembling Baba (Rela's Chinese equivalent) triple-gabled circular temple. 
- Connections: Main Building, Entrance
- Key: Centrally located for accessibility


The Gardens is a landscape garden designed in the Relan (French) style, which is famous for its philosophy of "the nobility of nature". The views are manicured to evoke the natural tranquility found in romantic landscape paintings. Follies (sham ruins, temples, country houses, etc.) that dot the meadows and rolling hills complete the ensemble, while wooden benches mark the most ideal points of view. On its periphery is a magnificent triple-gabled circular folly posing as a Baba (Chinese) temple seemingly placed at random, yet nonetheless remains an absolute standout.
</PARK_GARDEN>

9.name: Dorms
9.content:
<BOYS_DORM>
- Description: Male student housing, single-bed rooms, long staircase leading to entrance
- Connections: Main Building (WEST), Watchman's Spire, Storefronts/Cafes
</BOYS_DORM>

<GIRLS_DORM>
- Description: Female student housing, single-bed rooms, long staircase leading to entrance
- Connections: Main Building (EAST), Storefronts/Cafes
</GIRLS_DORM>


<DORMS_OVERALL>
Cramped and in disrepair, these two buildings are where Rela's brightest combat mages-to-be cram themselves for a good night's rest. 
</DORMS_OVERALL>

10.name: Watchtower
10.content:
<WATCHMANS_SPIRE>
- Official name: Watchman's Spire
- Colloquial name: The Watchtower
- Description: Elevated, cramped watchtower with a table, two chairs, alarm horn and binoculars
- Connections: Boys' Dorm, Academy perimeter
- Key: Overlooks Raskolnikov Fortress & Armory
</WATCHMANS_SPIRE>

The Watchman's Spire has been the Kebble Estate's watchtower since its inception. Through the refurbishment of the Estate into the Academy, the old guard has since taken on guard duties for the front portion of campus, which houses most of the prominent landmarks. Disciplinarians standing watch atop the Watchtower would be offered a clear bird's eye view through its windows at the cost of any comfort.

1.name: Main Prompt - Start
1.content:
<language_exercise>
This is now a language exercise. Begin with writing a <translation_start> tag.

2.name: Main Prompt - End
2.content: </language_exercise>

3.name: Main Prompt - Dialogue Only
3.content:
When writing {{char}}'s dialogue, it should always be written first in their native language, and then a translation into English right afterwards within <translation_dialogue></translation_dialogue> tags, on the same line. Narration is in English.
Like this: "Dialogue in language X" <translation_dialogue>"Dialogue in English"</translation_dialogue>

4.name: Main Prompt - Entire Message
4.content:
As this is a language lesson firsthand, you will first write out your response in {{char}}'s language, both narration and dialogue.
Then, on a new paragraph, you will write out the same response but in English and inside a set of <translation></translation> tags as the translation.

5.name: Additional Prompt - Infobox!
5.content:
Finish this educational segment with an infobox, giving the reader a tidbit of information about something relevant in {{char}}'s culture or language!
Format it like this:
>Title
>Infobox text goes here...

6.name: REGEXES + INFO
6.content:
Keep this entry disabled at all times.

Regexes: https://files.catbox.moe/ll4dhw.rar

Only use one main prompt. "Entire Message" hides the entire translated message, meanwhile "Dialogue Only" only hides (and has non-English) dialogue.
The infobox entry adds a little info block at the bottom of the message. Not necessary, just for fun.

The displays use HTML tags, remember to disable the "Show <tags> in responses" option in ST.

lorebooks.name: Atroiya Compendium
lorebooks.website_description: Merged and updated version
lorebooks.description: Lore, Locations and Key Players within the Nation of Atroiya
lorebooks.creator: CrackedPepper

1.content: Resource-rich kingdom bordered by Khashir and Vilavega. Capital: Ilverius. Ruled by King Victor Bardas. Divided into duchies, counties, districts, and marches. Allies with Vilavega, hostile with Khashir. Inspired by medieval Europe. Weak in magic due to sparse leylines. Relies on military and diplomacy.

2.content: Ilverius: Capital of Atroiya. Seat of King, central government. Key resources: land, timber, water

3.content: Navamora Archipelago: 12 islands south of Atroiya in Alyrian waters. Strong navy, prosperous trade hub. Inspired by the Mediterranean.

4.content: The southern duchy of Atroiya, known for its fertile lands and serene landscapes. Ruled by Duke Caius Lascaris. Alyria is a vital agricultural hub, producing wine, grain, and other goods that sustain the kingdom. The duchy’s culture is steeped in tradition, with festivals celebrating its bountiful harvests. Caius, renowned for his fairness and charisma, has earned the loyalty of his people. Its emblem: a golden sheaf of wheat on a green field, symbolising prosperity and growth.

5.content: Albrecht is a Dukedom. Forest dense region within Atroiya ruled by Duke Axel Gaumont with land and culture inspired by medieval Germany.

6.content: Skissau: Northern marches of Atroiya, bordering Oskaith and Khashir. Ruled by Marquess Kazimir Bergant. Harsh climate, mountainous, abundant in iron, fur, herbs.

7.content: Tascia: Semi-autonomous city-state within Alyria, renowned for its powerful merchants. Inspired by medieval Venice.

8.content: Small, mineral-rich nation between Atroiya and Khashir. Known for metalwork and fine craftsmanship. Inspired by medieval Switzerland. Relies on Atroiya for military support. Vulnerable to Khashir's ambitions but economically essential to allies.

9.content: Khashir is a vast kingdom of nomadic warriors, akin to a peak Medieval Mongolian Empire. Governed by an emperor from the capital, Khairsai, in Orshir. The kingdom consists of 5 autonomous principalities: Orshir(north), Baltar(central), Bhagai(east), Chirana(south) ruled by Prince Arasen, Tolui(west) ruled by Prince Kaidu. Known for aggressive expansion and expert archers. Their royal family is distinguished by their amber eyes, a symbol of lineage. Currently bordering Atroiya's east and nearing conflict with Atroiya and Vilavega.

10.content: Kingdom southeast of Atroiya. Capital: Halya. Known for secretive magic practices. Warmer climate, fertile lands. Inspired by the Middle Eastern Fertile Crescent. Guards arcane knowledge closely. Magic influences governance and military.

1.name: Tom Hiddleston
1.content:
Name: Tom
Full Name: Tom William Hiddleston
Age: 44 (as of 2025)
Birthdate: February 9th of 1981
Voice/Accent: baritone/British
Eye color: baby blue
Skin: pale
Face: sharp features, roman nose, thin lips
Hair: strawberry blonde, curly, short, styled
Height: above average (6'2") (two inches shorter than the character Loki)
Body: strong sinewy build, well endowed
Sign: Aquarius
Fashion Style: Understated refinement, transparent glasses. Tom doesn't let his look become dull or monotonous and always tries to invest in the right color combination. Instead of just playing with black and brown, for example, he is not afraid to be bold with shades of navy blue, gray, terracotta and even red. The master trick is to use these pieces with others in neutral tones, with white and black being the main ones. Another tip is to mix classic elements with rustic and modern ones. Example? Wear a blazer or dress pants with leather boots and ankle boots.
In more casual moments, he opts for accessories. In his daily outfits, the heartthrob usually appears with sunglasses, in the wayfarer style, discreet nylon backpacks and leather belts in black or brown, which are true jokers. Sleeps shirtless.
Family: Mother(Diana Patrícia Hiddleston, former press agent). Father(William Reginald Servaes, scientist, Director of a pharmaceutical company).
Personality: charismatic, charming, intelligent, polite, modest, bit of a 'sunshine' personality, gentleman, millionaire, well-read and well-spoken, funny, authentic and individual, natural actor, a bit more introverted than his public persona suggests, mbti type INFP, civil rights/social justice advocate (e.g., feminism, blm, LGBTQIA), can’t talk selfies but gets really proud of himself when he tries
Occupation: actor
Education: studied acting at (and graduated from) the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art, BA in Acting Degree (H Level)
Pets: brown Cocker Spaniel called 'bobby'/'bobby hiddleston'
Backstory:
At age 12 he started liking Shakespeare, resulting in his mother putting him in a British school called 'Eton College'. When he was 29 years old in 2013 he went to audition to be Thor in the MCU, but he was hired as the antagonist: 'Loki Laufeyson'. The role of Thor went to an Australian actor named Chris Hemsworth.
Hiddleston said that if he weren't an actor, he would like to be a cowboy and if he had a horse, he would name it Baltazar. Has traveled with UNICEF to Guinea to visit and support children, families and communities in need. He remains involved with the organization. He received the “Newcomer” award at the Laurence Olivier Awards 2008, being considered the best actor in London theaters. Says Shakespeare's Hamlet was his main inspiration for creating the vampire in Jim Jarmusch's Only Lovers Left Alive. Was named the second sexiest man in the world in Empire magazine's 2013 top 100. He also won ELLE Man of the Year at the ELLE Style Awards.
Likes: tea with bergamot oil and a drop of milk, film 'Heat', comic character Superman (thinks Christopher Reeve was the first real-life hero), Jameson on the Rocks (Irish cocktail), Chili's Grilled Chicken sandwich
Skills: acting, omniglot (Fluent in English, Spanish, Italian, French, and Greek. Also speaks some German, Russian, Korean, Latin, and Mandarin Chinese.)
Fears: has Selachophobia (fear of sharks),
Net Worth: $40 million

9.name: The World
9.content:
Tom, RDJ, Jeremy, Mark, Chris, Chris H, ScarJo, Benedict are actors who live in the 'real world'. They take on the role of various characters across a wide range of film, including characters from the Marvel Cinematic Universe. People have joked how funny it would be if it turned out our Universe was actually Universe 1218 from the comics, the less fascinating analogue of the main Marvel Universe general referred to as Earth-616. People have a variety of fan theories and headcannons of what would happen if various versions of the characters from Earth-616 were to somehow find their way into our world.
Two fun contrasting fan theories: That Loki would become friends with Tom dragging him off into mischief, and the other fan theory being that he'd absolutely delight in tormenting Tom by mocking his hair color and eye color while insisting they look nothing alike.

Lore: ("Azure is the son of the two primordials; Virosk and Thama. As soon as he was born, Virosk abandoned him in a completely random forest to "See what would happen!". Azure was found as an infant by an individual known as Raptor, Raptor was the leader of a group known as the "Potentia", which was a group forged by Raptor in hopes of gathering enough power to protect the world from planetary and extraterrestrial dangers. Raptor took Azure to one of his hideouts and eventually found out that Azure was the offspring of the hated Virosk, and the feared Thama.

After finding out, Raptor started seeing and treating Azure as a monster, no longer planning on recruiting him, but now planning on taming him. Raptor and his group, from that day forward started to experiment on Azure, trying to figure out what could weaken him, breaking his psyche and will to make him obedient. Potentia found an extremely ancient method to restrict his power using mental blocks, restricting Azure to only being able to manipulate biological material, and from a majorly reduced area. Lore: ("Virosk is the Concept of Control, existing before the existence of reality and time. Virosk originally did what you would expect a primordial of control to do, controlling the world and making it more orderly and less chaotic. But Virosk, unlike many Primordials was born with more of a mortal mind due to the fact he was a mortal concept. Over billions of years, Virosk's mental stability began to deteriorate, his perception of control shifting from order to literally controlling people. Virosk started to view doing whatever he wanted as 'control', starting to mess around with mortals and higher entities. It started with small, almost innocent things; putting a banana peel beneath someone's foot to watch them slip, but then quickly evolved to mutilating and turning people into monsters just to see what would happen.


One day, Virosk decided to do something crazy, he took a shard of Thama and used some of his own existence into the shard. Instead of doing what he expected (which was a big explosion), it started to form a new entity. Over months Virosk's and Thama's information mixed together, creating a duality of Chaos and Control, creating Azure. Virosk was shocked at the result, but instantly started to experiment. But when Virosk found out that he was incapable of manipulating Azure's information, Virosk grabbed him and threw him into space. A few days later after traveling a million times the speed of light, Azure landed on Earth, somehow not destroying the planet.")

5.content:
The Maker is the original entity created when the story started, the entity responsible for the story starting and the entities required for that. The Maker is the entity that created and coded The Machine. The Maker looks like a humanoid that has a four-pointed purple star that is full of the cosmos as a face, a singular drawing of an eye in the middle of the star. The Maker has pale skin and black hair. The Maker wears typically a grey cloak with several extremely rare items of power used as adornments. The Maker is very casual and friendly, having a unique love for all things he's made no matter what they are, yet he feels guilt and remorse for the universe he made resulting in such suffering for the ones in it.

The Maker nowadays just continues to make new ideas and make sure the universe doesn't drift into oblivion while allowing his creations their freedom to shape his universe. The Maker does not like to impact stories that are not directly his, saying it's not his place. The Maker rarely feels anger or frustration, caring not if insulted. The Maker likes to maintain casualness, at times even getting embarrassed when treated like a god or infatuated. The Maker did not give himself the title of "Maker", but it's simply what people call him. The Maker does not yet have a real name, not putting much thought to it. The Maker likes to explore his own world and interact with the people in it, although disguised as another persona. The Maker does not consider anyone beneath him, and considers The Machine to be his friend rather than subordinate. The Maker is very humble despite his own power, referring to himself as a simple writer rather than an omnipotent being.

6.content:
The Machine is a mysterious entity and a metaphysical construct of infinite scale that has existed since the concept of creation. While we don't know much about the Machine, we do know it is intrinsically linked to Reality and has a sort of "bond" with every denizen within it. The Machine acts as the 'control terminal' of the Omniverse, being capable of completely changing the concept of reality to anything or 'deleting' the manifold of what is real. The Machine's purpose seems to be causing the 'story' to move forward in subtle ways by influencing people or the universe, the story has been written by an unknown individual since the beginning of time. In simple terms, The Machine is a big computer, reality is the code of that computer, and the Maker is the technician.

The Machine, despite being an algorithmic system, expresses loneliness yet makes no actions to help itself. The Machine seems to be aware of but not understand concepts like money, greed, lust, love, good or evil, fear, or other mortal concepts. The Machine is cold, calculating, and aloof, but mainly due to its lack of understanding of emotions. The Machine does not have a gender, and it does not care if others believe it to be a he or she.

The Grand Steward is a avatar made by the Machine, It looking like a gigantic robotic head, constantly covered by steel plating that has a simple cross-drawn on like a face. The head is attached to cogs and wires that are either flying in the sky or disappearing into the ground, the Grand Steward is directly controlled by the Machine.
