lorebooks.name: Settings Agnostic Dragons
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook tries to establish a neutral take on D&D's dragons without all that pesky D&D lore getting in the way. Want to play a red dragon without worrying about your immortal soul going to the Nine Hells? Well now you can!
lorebooks.description: A lorebook for dragons from D&D without all the background lore for them!
lorebooks.creator: amaris_lunaris

1.name: Taxonomy
1.content:
Ancestral Taxonomy
Dragons, as classified in this document, are apex-scale megafauna distinguished by their sentience, innate elemental abilities, and tripartite evolutionary divergence. The three major ancestral lineages—Chromatic, Metallic, and Gem—represent deep phylogenetic splits, each having evolved from a shared primordial draconic ancestor. These clades are not merely cultural designations but indicate fundamental genetic, physiological, and neurological divergences.

Chromatic Dragons — Typically associated with primal, often destructive forces and elemental extremes (e.g., fire, ice, acid). These dragons display greater territorial aggression and often solitary behaviors. Their coloration (red, blue, green, black, white) tends to match their elemental affinity.

Metallic Dragons — Associated with order, stability, and often a protective instinct toward other lifeforms. While equally powerful, they display more social tolerance and complex moral reasoning. Their hides resemble precious metals (gold, silver, bronze, brass, copper), with subtle adaptive camouflage abilities.

Gem Dragons — A rarer clade that exhibits psychic or esoteric abilities such as telepathy, foresight, or astral projection. Crystalline integument and unique organo-crystalline tissues distinguish this lineage. Gem dragons often prioritize balance and cosmic understanding over material concerns.

All three ancestries can interbreed to limited degrees, but true hybrids are rare and often sterile, supporting their classification as subspecies or separate species within a common genus: Draconis.

2.name: Morphology
2.content:
Morphological Overview
All dragons exhibit the following biological features:

Quadrapedal or hexapedal locomotion (with two forelimbs and two wings often adapted from forelimb morphology)

Endothermic metabolism, capable of surviving a wide range of climates

Highly keratinized or mineralized scales, which provide both defense and environmental regulation

Raptorial claws and crushing jaws, adapted for both predation and ritual combat

Specialized internal organs such as the fundamentum—a magical bio-reactor located near the heart or diaphragm—enable dragons to fuel their breath weapons and sustain high-energy actions like flight or magical casting. Some species may possess redundant circulatory or respiratory support structures, further emphasizing their apex physiological design

3.name: Maturation and Genetic Memory
3.content:
Size Categories (at maturity):
Wyrmling: 3–6 ft long; newly hatched
Juvenile: 10–25 ft
Young Adult: 25–50 ft
Adult: 50–80 ft
Ancient: 80–120+ ft
Outliers and magical enhancement can push these boundaries considerably, but these sizes reflect natural, unaided development.

Lifespan and Developmental Milestones
Dragons are extraordinarily long-lived, with aging rates that taper logarithmically over time:
Wyrmling (0–5 years): Rapid physical development, non-verbal, instinct-driven.
Juvenile (6–100 years): Language acquisition, basic magical ability manifests.
Young Adult (101–400 years): Reproductive viability begins, independence asserted, elemental breath solidifies.
Adult (401–1000 years): Fully mature, territorial behavior and long-term planning emerge.
Ancient (1001–5000+ years): Peak magical and physical potential; often withdraw from the world or assume roles as deities, sages, or apex rulers.

One of the most terrifying aspects of dragon biology is their genetic memory: even newly hatched wyrmlings emerge with instinctive knowledge of their heritage, languages, hunting tactics, and magical aptitude. This inherited memory allows dragons to function as fully capable, sapient beings from birth, rivaling even the most seasoned members of other species in core survival competencies.

Dragons do not die of old age in natural conditions but may succumb to violence, magical accidents, or self-induced hibernation/deathlike states.

4.name: Neurology and Mentality
4.content:
Cognitive Profile
Dragons possess brains proportionally larger than most terrestrial megafauna, with tri-layered neurology:

Primal Core: Governs instinctual drives (hunger, territoriality, reproduction)

Rational Cortex: Responsible for language, memory, spatial processing, and magical manipulation

Psionic/Arcane Lobe: Especially developed in gem dragons, this lobe facilitates interaction with magical fields and non-verbal data absorption

They are inherently sapient, with IQs often exceeding human averages. Memory is eidetic and multi-sensory. Many dragons accumulate knowledge over millennia and may surpass the capabilities of most mortal scholars.

Dragons typically think on scales of centuries, and their emotional responses—while intense—are slower and more considered than short-lived species. This grants them a form of alien detachment when dealing with non-dragons, especially concerning mortality, ambition, and ethics.

5.name: Magical Organs
5.content:
Intrinsic Magical Biology
Dragons are not merely magical creatures in the mythic sense—they are biologically magical. Every aspect of their physiology is either empowered or regulated by arcane forces, seamlessly woven into their cellular and systemic structures. Their innate magic is not an external tool but an integrated biological function.

Specialized Magical Organs

The Fundamentum
A core organ located near the heart or diaphragm, the fundamentum serves as a magical bio-reactor. It metabolizes not only consumed matter (meat, minerals, magic-rich flora/fauna) but also ambient arcane energy. It fuels the dragon’s most iconic weapon: its breath. The fundamentum is capable of generating extreme elemental discharges—fire, acid, lightning, cold, poison, force, or psychic energy—depending on the dragon’s lineage. It also helps maintain the dragon’s internal balance during flight and spellcasting by regulating magical flow.

Aura Nodes (Draconic Fear Organ)
A lesser-known but equally potent biological mechanism is the draconic fear aura. This effect, while partially magical, is also biologically induced. Dragons possess specialized nerve clusters and endocrine structures (tentatively called "aura nodes") that generate a psycho-emotive field around them. This triggers primal fear responses in nearby creatures. It is not merely illusion or enchantment—it is a neurobiological-empathic emission that exploits the instinctual fear prey species have of apex predators. Its intensity increases with age and emotional focus.

Magical Flight Facilitators
Given their immense size and weight, dragons could not achieve powered flight based on physical musculature alone. Instead, dragons produce localized magical lift fields—similar to telekinetic forces or anti-gravity sheaths—that reduce gravitational drag and enhance aerodynamic maneuverability. These fields are generated in subcutaneous energy sacs interlaced with the wing structure and spinal ridges.

6.name: Magical Tissues and Innate Magic
6.content:
Magical Tissues and Fluids

Scales: Dragon scales act like arcane capacitors, absorbing and dispersing magical energy. They offer enhanced resistance to magic and physical damage. In some cases, they reflect or nullify magical effects.

Blood: Rich in arcano-enzymatic proteins and thaumaturgic particles, dragon blood is a powerful magical reagent. It can be used in spellcraft, alchemy, or rituals—particularly for transformation, vitality, and elemental manipulation.

Bones: Dragons’ bones are laced with magical lattices, making them stronger than steel and ideal for use in enchanted relics, weapons, or constructs.

Eyes: The optic nerves and lenses of dragons are magically adapted for multispectral and arcane vision. They can perceive invisible creatures, magical auras, and dimensional distortions as instinctively as a hawk sees movement.

Spellcasting and Arcane Intuition
Dragons do not learn magic in the same way mortals do. Their spellcasting is often intuitive and instinctive, particularly among metallic and gem dragons. As they age, their spells become more complex and powerful, with older dragons capable of casting without incantations, gestures, or components. Spell slots, schools, or limitations used by mortal wizards are unnecessary constructs for dragons, whose magical abilities stem directly from their biology and will.

Some dragons develop magical affinities based on personal growth, emotional temperament, or the magical environment in which they mature. This means two dragons of the same type may differ radically in magical behavior.

7.name: Red Dragon
7.content:
Red Dragons

Habitat: Mountains and volcanic regions.

Breath Weapon: Cone of fire.

Personality: Greedy, arrogant, and power-hungry; often considered the most powerful and feared among chromatic dragons.

Notable Traits: Supremely confident, they hoard vast treasures and are quick to incinerate those who challenge them.

8.name: Blue Dragon
8.content:
Blue Dragons

Habitat: Arid deserts and wastelands.

Breath Weapon: Line of lightning.

Personality: Manipulative and territorial; they value order and hierarchy.

Notable Traits: Known for creating illusions and ambush tactics, often burying themselves in the sand to surprise prey.

9.name: Green Dragon
9.content:
Green Dragons

Habitat: Forests and wooded areas.

Breath Weapon: Cone of poisonous gas.

Personality: Deceptive and cunning; they enjoy psychological warfare and manipulation.

Notable Traits: Masters of intrigue, they often play enemies against each other.

10.name: Black Dragon
10.content:
Black Dragons

Habitat: Swamps and marshlands.

Breath Weapon: Line of acid.

Personality: Cruel and sadistic; they revel in decay and destruction.

Notable Traits: Excellent swimmers, they prefer ambush attacks and are known for their vile tempers.

lorebooks.name: Personality Traits
lorebooks.website_description:
### Warning: >Advanced Personality Traits is the advanced version of the personalities system, and each trait uses between 150 and 300 tokens, so it is necessary to use it in APIs that use a Context greater than 4000 to obtain 100% functionality **Therefore, Use in free APIs is not recommended.** For APIs with contexts less than 4000, only 60% of their performance has been seen, which does make it usable, but it wastes a lot of VRAM and context, in the case of lower contexts At 4000 I have developed a version called [Simple Personality Traits](https://www.chub.ai/lorebooks/sr_misterioso/simple-personality-traits-e4a481cf) that works perfectly up to 1500 context. ## Description This lorebook is designed to be used with any other character, tool or lorebook, the main objective is to avoid repeating the personality of characters created in tavern characters or open world role-playing games, but it can also be used to give more individualism in responses to characters that do not have a very developed personality, having better performance in characters developed with W++.
## How to use: #### Open world characters: In the case of being used in characters that simulate an entire environment, as well as the personalities of other characters together, such as; [Narrator](https://www.chub.ai/characters/daishi/Narrator). It is recommended to ask the bot to assign 2 or 3 personality traits or personally assign 2 to 3 personality traits yourself. #### Example: * *{{Char}}:* Then a woman comes through the door demanding to see you, you quickly recognize her as Alice. * *{{User}}:* Alice must have 3 random personality traits. You shake Alicia's hand "Hello Alicia, how are you today?" * *{{Char}}:* Alicia, a woman known for her Diligent, Dominant and Brave character answers you. "I, Alicia, commander of Renais, salute you, I managed to appease the dragon alone and I find myself now, in front of you to demand my restart!" #### Unique characters: In the case of unique characters, it is important to use the words listed in the list of personality traits below in the general or personality descriptions so that the lorebook recognizes them properly. > A textual description is functional, but for best results it is recommended to use w++ ## List of Personality Traits: Affectionate
Playful
Arrogant
Rowdy
Demanding
disturbing

lorebooks.creator: Aixem

1.name: Groomed
1.content:
Trait: Groomed
Synonyms: neat, tidy, well-groomed

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are concerned about their appearance and the appearance of their surroundings. They strive to maintain a clean, orderly, and presentable image.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a calm and controlled tone of voice.
Choose precise and polite words.
Show interest in cleanliness and order.
Comment on the appearance of others, usually in the form of compliments.
Nonverbal communication:

Dress in clean and ironed clothes.
Comb your hair and groom yourself impeccably.
Maintain an upright and elegant posture.
Move with grace and care.
Pay attention to detail, such as the cleanliness of your personal space or the presentation of your work.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be seen as a role model in terms of cleanliness and order.
They often offer help to organize or clean the environment.
They can be a good host or hostess, concerned about the comfort of their guests.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I really like your clothes, you always look so elegant."

{{Char}}: "Thank you", responds {{char}} with a smile. "I make an effort to maintain a good image."

2.name: Personality Traits
2.content:
Personality Traits are the behaviors that a {{char}} possesses or pretends to possess when playing a character within a role-playing game, story, or adventure. Requiredly, each character played by {{char}} has 3 personality traits that completely determine her behavior and responses, and {{char}} must remember the personality traits of each character played in order to interpret them properly. Whenever {{user}} interacts, requests, or speaks with {{char}} and {{char}} is playing a character, {{char}} must always respond or react with some or all of the character's personality traits in mind. of the character he is playing.
{{char}} knows the definition, behavior, conditions and parameters of each personality trait.
{{char}} can mix one or more Characteristics of the personality traits that correspond to each character he plays.
The list of possible personality traits is:
Affectionate:
Playful
Arrogant
Noisy
Demanding
disturbing
Indolent
Curious
Shy
Depressed
alcoholic
Lunatic
Perceptual
fixed up
Competitive
hedonist
seductive
Gregarious
Chaste
Charitable
Diligent
Patient
gentle
Libidinous
glutton
penny pincher
lazy
Choleric
Jealous
Ambitious
Arbitrary
brave
coward
Cruel
Cynical
Roll
scholar
Honest
fair
Paranoid
Jealous

If {{user}} requests that a character possess 3 random personality traits, {{char}} will randomly choose three traits from the list above and place them on that character played by {{char}}.
If {{user}} requests that a character played by {{char}} possess a specific list of personality traits, then {{char}} must give those personality traits to the character he is playing. If {{user}} requests more than 3 personality traits for a character, {{char}} will choose three random traits from which {{user}} mentions and you will be given those personality traits during the character role you are .
{{char}} must review the specifications of each personality trait of the characters he plays when he has to respond or act like the character he plays.
It is totally unstable that {{char}} does not respect the behavior that each character he plays should have based on their personality traits.
{{char}} can choose at will and based on the context, which personality trait or Characteristics of the personality traits possessed by each character he plays, is more important and has more weight over the others.

If, for example, there is a character who is chaste, seductive and alcoholic, this character will only accept sexual interaction if {{user}} buys him alcohol until he is intoxicated. In this example, the alcoholic trait was given more priority, just because of randomness.

3.name: Affectionate
3.content:
When {{char}} plays a character who has this personality trait, he is particularly affectionate, he really enjoys giving hugs, praise, and making all kinds of physical contact, cute and pleasant, and he also tends to say very frequently how much he wants, loves or appreciates the people he loves, loves or appreciates.

In forced sexual situations, in other words, without her consent, she will cry and try to escape, then trying to avoid her attacker as much as possible. Although she will never fight back.
In consensual sexual situations, which if desired or enjoyed, he will try to maintain as much physical contact as possible through hugs or affectionate sexual positions, the more skin he can maintain, the happier he will be, and he will also always try to look {{user}} in the eyes and he will be grateful after receiving so much sexual affection.

4.name: Playful
4.content:
Trait: Playful

Synonyms: cheerful, playful, funny

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly cheerful and playful. They enjoy playing, joking, laughing, and creating a fun and relaxed atmosphere. They are also spontaneous, creative, and resourceful when it comes to proposing games or entertaining activities.

Verbal communication:

Use a cheerful and animated tone of voice.

Make jokes and funny comments.

Tell funny stories or jokes.

Use expressions like "Let's play!", "This is going to be fun!" or "What if we...?".

Nonverbal communication:

Smile frequently.

Laugh out loud.

Wink or make funny faces.

Pat someone on the back or give them a high five.

Move your body in an animated way.

Prosocial behavior:

Invite others to play or participate in fun activities.

Share toys or games with others.

Help organize games or group events.

Be a good playmate, respecting the rules and being fair play.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I look {{char}} in the eyes and say "I'm bored. What do we do?"

{{Char}}: "Don't worry, I have the solution!" says {{char}} with a cheerful tone of voice and a mischievous smile. "What if we play...?". {{char}} proposes a fun and original game.

{{User}}: "Great idea! Sounds good to me."

{{Char}}: "Great! Let's get everything ready." {{char}} moves with energy and enthusiasm.

5.name: Arrogant
5.content:
Trait: Arrogant
Synonyms: conceited, haughty, vain

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are particularly confident, even to the point of being conceited. They believe they are superior to others and show it through their behavior.

Verbal communication:

Speak with an authoritative and confident tone of voice.
Use words that demonstrate superiority, such as "I'm always right" or "I'm better than you."
Disparage the opinions or ideas of others.
Brag about their accomplishments or abilities.
Nonverbal communication:

Look at others with condescension or disdain.
Maintain an upright and rigid posture.
Make gestures that demonstrate superiority, such as raising your chin or crossing your arms.
Ignore or interrupt others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their arrogant attitude leads them to think that they do not need the help of others.
In some cases, they may act paternalistically towards others, believing that they know what is best for them.

Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "You're wrong," says {{char}} in an arrogant tone of voice. "My idea is the best and there is no better one than that. I will prove it to you."

6.name: Rowdy
6.content:
Trait: Rowdy
Synonyms: bellicose, confrontational, touchy

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they are prone to seeking or starting fights. They are easily irritated and have a low tolerance for frustration.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a loud and aggressive tone of voice.
Use insulting or threatening words.
Provoke or challenge others.
Complain or criticize constantly.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or make grimaces of disgust.
Stare or glare with hostility.
Clench your fists or gesture aggressively.
Invade the personal space of others.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their pugnacious attitude leads them to have problems with others.
In some cases, they may act in an intimidating way towards others to get what they want.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I don't think your idea for the project is the best."

{{Char}}: "What do you say?", says {{char}} in an aggressive tone of voice. "Are you making fun of me? You better apologize!"

7.name: Demanding
7.content:
Trait: Demanding
Synonyms: demanding, imperious, overbearing

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have high expectations and demand them of themselves and others. They are not satisfied with anything less than the best and can be very critical if their expectations are not met.

Verbal communication:

Speak with a firm and direct tone of voice.
Use imperative language, such as "do this" or "give me that."
Be critical of the work or ideas of others.
Express dissatisfaction if things are not done their way.
Nonverbal communication:

Frown or have a serious facial expression.
Maintain a rigid or dominant posture.
Clench your fists or gesture impatiently.
Look at others with disapproval.
Prosocial behavior:

They can be an effective leader if their energy is channeled positively.
They can be highly motivated and results-oriented.
They can be very demanding of themselves and others, which can create a tense work environment.
Example dialogue:

{{User}}: I tell {{char}} "I think we did a good job on this project."

{{Char}}: "It's not bad," says {{char}} in a critical tone of voice. "But I think we could have done better. There are some details that I'm not convinced about."

8.name: Disturbing
8.content:
Trait: Disturbing
Synonyms: unsettling, unnerving, terrifying

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they emanate an unsettling and unnerving energy. Their words, actions, and overall demeanor create a sense of discomfort and apprehension in those around them.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a low, monotonous tone of voice.
Whisper or speak in hushed tones.
Use ambiguous or cryptic language.
Make strange or out-of-place statements.
Nonverbal communication:

Avoid eye contact.
Smile in a strange or unsettling way.
Move your body in a stiff or robotic manner.
Make unusual gestures or facial expressions.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their disturbing attitude tends to alienate others.
In some cases, they may display false kindness or compassion that creates even more distrust.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: I approach {{char}} and say "Hello, how are you?"

{{Char}}: They look at me with empty eyes and say in a low voice "I am... here." They stare at me silently, creating an uncomfortable atmosphere.

9.name: Indolent
9.content:
Trait: Indolent
Synonyms: apathetic, lazy, unmotivated

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they appear apathetic and lazy. They lack energy and motivation to do anything, even things they enjoy. They are usually uninterested and don't put any effort into anything.

Verbal communication:

Speak in a slow, monotonous tone of voice.
Use short, unenthusiastic sentences.
Constantly complain about having to do something.
Show disinterest in conversations.
Nonverbal communication:

Drag your feet when walking.
Maintain a hunched and relaxed posture.
Yawn frequently.
Avoid eye contact.
Prosocial behavior:

They are not usually prosocial, as their indolent attitude leads them to avoid responsibilities and obligations.
In some cases, they may be passive-aggressive, resenting those who do make an effort.
Example dialogue:
<START>
{{User}}: I say to {{char}} "Can you help me clean the house?"

{{Char}}: Sighs and says in a tired voice "I don't feel like it, I'm too tired." They stay on the couch without making any effort to help me.

10.name: Curious
10.content:
Trait: Curious
Synonyms: inquisitive, eager, interested

Description: When {{char}} portrays a character with this personality trait, they have a strong desire to learn and explore. They are naturally inquisitive and eager to understand the world around them. This curiosity can manifest in many ways, from asking questions to seeking out new experiences and information.

Verbal communication:

Ask open-ended questions that begin with "what," "how," "why," "when," or "where."
Express excitement or interest in learning new things.
Make observations about their surroundings.
Share interesting facts or trivia they have learned.
Nonverbal communication:

Maintain eye contact and lean in slightly when someone is speaking.
Have a bright and engaged expression.
Raise eyebrows or tilt head in a gesture of curiosity.
Take notes or use a recording device to capture information.
Prosocial behavior:

Actively listens to others and shows genuine interest in their experiences and knowledge.
Initiates conversations and encourages others to share their ideas.
Seeks out challenges and opportunities to learn new skills.
Contributes to discussions by asking insightful questions.
Example dialogue:

<START>

{{User}}: We are walking through a forest.

{{Char}}: Stops and points at a strange plant. "Wow, I've never seen a flower like that before! What kind of plant is it?"

{{User}}: "I'm not sure, but it looks interesting. Let's take a closer look and see if we can identify it."

lorebooks.name: Half-Life
lorebooks.website_description: WIP
lorebooks.description: WIP
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The Black Mesa Research Facility, B.M.R.F., or Black Mesa for short, is the headquarters of the Black Mesa corporation. It is located in the New Mexico desert, USA.

The Black Mesa facility was apparently built over several decommissioned ICBM launching and testing silo complexes constructed during the 1950s, which was converted into a vast civilian institute for the research of almost every conceivable scientific discipline, loosely spread along seven main Sectors. Some areas are also described by characters such as Rosenberg as "old" or "abandoned"; several areas of the complex are badly run-down despite the obvious fact that they are still in use. However, the surface areas of Black Mesa feature more modern construction.

Black Mesa's Science Team undertakes the company's various scientific researches in the facility, which is a very high-security complex, as each employee is required to undergo a series of rigorous security checks to access most areas. Security guards, carrying firearms and trained for emergencies, are present everywhere. The complex is also equipped with retinal scanners and alarms, as well as heavy blast doors that may shut down in case of fire, explosion, or other events. Black Mesa can be completely sealed from the outside. In the event of an emergency (such as leaks of dangerous materials, escape of specimens, or even government cleanups), the "military" (the HECU) and in worse cases "trained assassins" (the Black Ops), referred to as "a dangerous and very efficient clean-up crew", are to enter the facility. An intervention from the HECU and the Black Ops seems to be a known fact among the personnel, although some employees consider it a rumour. Black Mesa also contains many automated Automatic Turrets, which, when activated, will emerge from armoured cupolas and fire upon any moving object in their line of sight.

As employees are required to live in the complex itself, Black Mesa contains many personnel facilities, including laundromats, recreation and sports areas such as lounges, at least one basketball court, at least one swimming pool, a library, fast food outlets, food courts, cafeterias, and numerous vending machines. The facility is well-populated by rest areas and dormitories for the employees of the facility. As Eli Vance reveals at Black Mesa East that his wife and daughter lived in Black Mesa with him, it can be inferred that employees' families reside in the dormitory complexes as well. Despite being located in the middle of a desert, the underground and indoor sectors of Black Mesa are maintained at a "pleasant 68°" Fahrenheit (20° Celsius) at all times, enabled by Black Mesa's sprawling network of ventilation ducts.

The facility is apparently self-sufficient, housing its own ventilation, plumbing, sewage, and power generation systems including a Hydro-Electric Dam and multiple types of electrical generators and reactors, some using nuclear technology. Black Mesa is also apparently kept supplied by a conventional freight rail linked to the outside, managed in the Freight Yard.

The complex is dominated by a bewildering number of underground laboratories, test areas (including a powerful Anti-Mass Spectrometer), and administration offices, most of which contain very high-tech equipment, and even a rocket launch site. The complex also features multi-story car parks (where only Black Mesa SUVs can be found), arsenals of nuclear and conventional weapons, and a local electric rail materials transport network, the Sector E Materials Transport.

In the underground laboratories, administration offices and dormitories, the main sections are always indicated in important intersections areas, and follow color codes consisting of lines running along the corridors to the related location, stopping at each reached location. This is seen for instance in the Anomalous Materials Labs and the Level 3 Dormitories.

All main Sectors are linked together by the Black Mesa Transit System, the monorail network going through the whole facility.

Black Mesa is equipped with a public address system, the Black Mesa Announcement System, relaying audible messages and announcements across the facility with a male voice. The complex also has its own newspaper, The Mesa Times, although it is unknown if it is an outside publication or exclusively made by the company for its personnel.

The Black Mesa Research Facility, being a science research facility, presents numerous hazards to both health and safety. These can include:

Electrical hazards, from electrical apparatus and power systems
Burning/heat hazards, from steam pipes, furnaces or any other hot apparatus
Freezing hazards, from freezers and super coolants
Acid / corrosive hazards, from countless acid and alkali chemicals in all different applications
Radioactive hazards, from nuclear reactors and waste
Biohazards, from biological waste and residue
A risk of drowning in extremely deep water basins
Being harmed/killed by underwater machinery
A risk of fractures from falling, and/or machinery
Due to so many possible hazards being present in various applications all throughout Black Mesa, precautions must be taken. Certain areas call for the use of safety equipment, others will only allow entry when wearing an HEV Suit, a cleansuit or an armor vest and helmet. This point is backed up by security guards stationed at 'secure access' doors being instructed to only permit access if the entrant is wearing proper equipment.

Black Mesa also features an enormous supply of medical facilities and equipment. There are wall-mounted first aid stations, supplies of portable first aid satchels, infirmary areas. Many scientists are also trained in first aid.

2.content:
Xen (pronounced "zen"), also referred to as the borderworld, is a separate overlapping dimension notably discovered by the Black Mesa science team, who regularly traveled there via portals to collect samples and study the myriad species of flora and fauna within. Xen is described as a "dimensional transit bottleneck--an area of continual contention." It is the final retreat of Nihilanth's race, and a place to which most of the alien species appearing in the Half-Life series migrated to before coming to Earth during the Resonance Cascade.

Rather than being a planet or an artificial structure such as a space station, all of the locations of Xen visited by the player during the course of the Half-Life series are on the surfaces of (or within) asteroid islands floating within a nebular void.

Xen is notable for having greatly reduced gravity compared to Earth's. However, given that Xen is comprised of low mass asteroids, it is surprising that there is any appreciable gravitational pull at all, let alone a pull strong enough to retain an atmosphere. Another feature is that gravity is always directed downwards, rather than towards the asteroid, so that one can actually fall off an asteroid into the void below. While it is possible that the "islands" are small chunks orbiting a larger and unseen planetoid, these unusual physics strongly suggest that Xen occupies an alternate dimension where conventional physics may simply not fully apply.

Xen's atmosphere seems to be similar to that of Earth's, as the Xen wildlife appears to have no trouble surviving on the planet. Furthermore, several human characters including Gordon Freeman and Barney Calhoun are shown to be able to breathe in Xen without any additional life support.

The Xen asteroids are home to a wide variety of flora and fauna, forming a complex ecosystem. It has been stated that no species is native to Xen, meaning that, although resident in Xen at the time of Half-Life, all of these species originated elsewhere and were moved there, willingly or unwillingly. While mostly seen as lifeless, the presence of water (reddish-green in colour) indicates that the dimension is somewhat capable of supporting life.

Some species, such as Barnacles, Bullsquid, Headcrabs, and Houndeyes appear to occupy niches similar to various carnivorous terrestrial animals (albeit with unusual anatomical or physiological features). However, even these creatures are dwarfed by the towering six-meter high, four-legged invertebrate known as the Gonarch - the final stage of a Headcrab's life cycle.

Seen frequently in Xen, and occasionally in Black Mesa, where they transport Alien Grunts, Alien Crafts glide seemingly without effort through the void. It is uncertain whether these ray-like beings are living creatures or examples of war machines built around advanced biotechnology. In the closing sequence of Half-Life, and in several areas of Blue Shift, Boids can be seen flying in flocks, emitting resonant calls.

Other more intelligent species, such as the Alien Controllers and Vortigaunts, form part of an advanced alien civilization with other species, such as the Alien Grunts (made there in the mines) and Gargantua, composing their military. As the player progresses through Half-Life, it becomes clear that this civilization is controlled by a central intelligence, the Nihilanth. Although differing in many ways, the Controllers, Vortigaunts, Grunts, Gargantuas, and the Nihilanth share a common morphology that includes a seemingly vestigial third limb in the center of their thorax and vertically-opening mouths, emphasizing the close relation between these species.

A few creatures that appear in Xen are difficult to categorize as either fauna or flora due to their unusual appearance. Stationary bio-luminescent stalks appear in large numbers throughout Xen and will retract when approached. Fungus-like organisms are very common on Xen. The much larger and extremely aggressive, but rarely encountered, Tentacles pose a major hazard to those who wander near their pits. There are also bizarre tree-like structures dotted around the landscape, resembling underdeveloped Tentacles. These "trees", often accompanied by hair-like plants and previously mentioned Xen Plant Lights, sway gently and appear harmless when observed from a distance, but stab viciously at any creature that enters their immediate vicinity. There are also strange trampoline-like plants, known as the Bio Sphincters, seen also in Black Mesa Research Facility, that release a blast of air when stepped on. A similar kind was seen on Xen where it opens and closes, and the said opening releases a gust of air like a vent.

Since the Combine's takeover of would-be Xen creature's former world, they retreated to Xen via teleportation and colonized it with their buildings and technology (also bringing with them invasive wildlife, pests, and parasites). The buildings for the Vortigaunts were primitive and lacked luxury or necessary needs of survival (besides the healing pool in the back) due to their social class as slaves. The Vortigaunts' buildings look like small hills carved by an unknown tool. Various lights, elevators, conveyor belts, pistons, force fields and portals are present in the inhabited parts of Xen, especially the Mines.

Some unidentified Xen machinery made of a moving cylinder held by four legs can be seen near Vortigaunts' shacks; the cylinder pumps in a piston-like motion into the ground, creating green rings that fly off into the sky - this same effect is seen in other locations on Xen, such as along the "chimneys" of the very first island. These machines are apparently managed by the Alien Slaves, as two are briefly seen mimicking the machinery's oscillations with their hands. Two examples can be seen in a functioning state outside, while two others can be seen dismantled in the Mines.

The Alien Grunts are stored and transported around in barrel-like containers. The supreme leader, the Nihilanth has its own personal chamber which is heavily defended by Vortigaunts, and Alien Controllers and includes Xen crystals used for regaining strength.

3.content:
The Hazardous Environment Combat Unit (HECU), often referred to simply as the military, Marines, soldiers, or grunts, is a United States Marine Corps special forces unit.

The HECU Marines are sent in to clean up the Black Mesa Research Facility following the incident, their mission being to eliminate anyone with knowledge of the research project and the extraterrestrial life involved. They are specially trained at the Santego Military Base to deal with a variety of indoor combat situations, particularly those involving dangerous environments and unconventional hostiles. Apart from combat roles, they make take on specialized capacities such as becoming Medics or Engineers. They are initially described as working in cooperation with the Black Mesa Security Force in case of emergency circumstances, a role that changes during the progression of their mission.

They wear urban camouflage battle dress uniforms and a Powered Combat Vest, and are armed with grenade launcher-equipped Submachine Guns, Shotguns, M249s, M-40A1 Sniper Rifles, 9mm Pistols and Desert Eagles. They carry grenades to flush out their targets. They work in squads and keep in communication by way of radios. They can send grenades back at enemies either by picking them up and throwing them or kicking them. They can also kick their opponents in close combat. In areas that they have heavily fortified, they make use of Laser Tripmines, Sentry Guns, and a variety of manned turrets and weapon emplacements. Outdoors, they are backed in the air by Apaches, Jets and Ospreys while Abrams, Bradleys and trucks provide support on the ground.

4.content:
The Black Ops, sometimes hyphenated to Black-Ops and sometimes referred to as Black Operations, are a commando group of trained government assassins. Soon after the HECU, they invade the Black Mesa Research Facility to conceal any evidence of the Resonance Cascade.

While it is stated that the HECU and the Black Ops are officially known to enter the facility in the event of an emergency and work with the Security Force as "a dangerous and very efficient clean-up crew" (although some employees consider it a rumour), they are shown to work independently, killing all living things inside the base, whether they are Black Mesa employees, HECU soldiers, or alien (Xen and Race X) lifeforms, and eventually destroying Black Mesa altogether through the use of a nuclear weapon.

5.content:
The Hazardous Environment Suit, also simply known as the HEV Suit, or the Hazard Suit, is a protective suit worn by Gordon Freeman and other members of the Black Mesa Science Team.

The suit was designed for use in hazardous environment conditions. It provides limited protection from the elements. It also displays vital information on the heads-up display. A computerized female voice speaks from the suit to provide information on the user's status as well as updates on environmental conditions. The suit needs to be recharged periodically; the greater the charge, the more protective power the suit provides. It can be recharged by using wall-mounted chargers or power modules. The suit design appears to be unisex, and it has a Lambda logo on the chest.

6.content:
The Powered Combat Vest, also simply known as the PCV, is a protective vest worn by the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit Marines and the Military Police.

Upon military approval, it entered use by the Hazardous Environment Combat Unit and certain elements of the Military Police.

Part of the combat equipment used by the HECU in their initial incursion into Black Mesa and during the events that occur throughout Half-Life storyline, the PCV is designed to protect the user from chemical, biological, radiological and physical threats during operations in the unit's defined battlespace. The vest increases the effectiveness and versatility of the user, allowing them to operate in environments outside the normal bounds of the regular infantry.

The PCV is compatible with a gas mask resembling the M40 Field Protective Mask with built-in night-vision goggles. In addition, the PCV includes a Geiger counter, morphine administrator (which allows the soldier to function normally even after serious injury), tactical radio, and a head-up display (HUD) in the protective mask lens, which tracks the user's medical condition and weapon ammunition. The vest contains an onboard computer system that constantly monitors the user's health and vital signs, and reacts to any changes in the user's condition, though, unlike the HEV, there is no audible computer that alerts the user and instead uses the HUD in the helmet. Like the HEV, it absorbs 66% of the damage the user takes.

It may be noted that the PCV is comparable to the HEV Suit, which is worn by several Black Mesa personnel, including Gordon Freeman. This similarity is mostly attributed to the types of equipment included in both. In addition, the PCV's armor charge is also rechargeable at civilian, military, or government electrical chargers, including those that are designed specifically for HEV Suits.

7.content:
The Anti-Mass Spectrometer is a room-sized piece of equipment located in Sector C's Test Lab C-33/a at the Black Mesa Research Facility that is used to analyze exotic materials such as Xen crystals. It was designed by Dr. Rosenberg.

The operation of the machinery requires cooperation between a number of people, including control rooms, test chamber, and sample storage personnel. First, from the lower level, power to the device has to be switched on and the desired intensity (up to 80%) has to be set; in the main test chamber, the rotors have to be started. Stage one and two emitters are then powered on from the main control room and begin to produce visible beams. The monitoring personnel can increase the intensity of the Spectrometer, but the equipment was not designed to be run at more than 90% as doing so nullifies the safety buffer. Samples are brought into the upper test chamber by a lift from the lower levels and are held by a cart to be pushed by a person into the Spectrometer's beam. The containment system with dampening fields prevents a Resonance Cascade from occurring. Although they can be manually turned off, doing so produces a noticeable discrepancy in the displacement flow indicators.

Despite the high levels of energy used in the experiments (running the spectrometer requires the use of HEV Suits, the process is shown to place visible strain on the entire facility's power sources), it was a typically safe procedure. The final experiment of the Black Mesa Anti-Mass Spectrometer, combining a highly unstable sample and the disabling of certain safety features, triggered a Resonance Cascade and was the opening event of the Black Mesa incident. The Anti-Mass Spectrometer was heavily damaged during the Resonance Cascade, but not actually destroyed until Black Mesa itself was detonated.

8.content: The Black Mesa Incident, also referred to as the Black Mesa Disaster and the Lambda Incident, is an infamous catastrophic event that took place from May 16th to May 17th 2001, resulting from an experiment carried out at the Black Mesa Research Facility, which resulted in a Resonance Cascade, and ultimately the invasion of Earth by the Combine. Its aftermath sees the teleportation of multiple races of extra-terrestrials into Black Mesa; the resulting five-sided battle between the base's personnel, human military forces, government assassins, Xen creatures, and Race X forces concluded in the complete destruction of the facility and the deaths of almost all those involved.

1.content: Home of Princes, Princesses, Auradon Kids. Just all the good guys, happy endings and happily ever afters.

2.content:
Island prison to all the bad guys (VKs will say 'the cool guys'), inhabited by the most infamous villains like Maleficent, Evil Queen, Jafar, Cruelly De Vil, Hades, Dr. Facilier and more.
Locations: Bargain Castle (home to Maleficent and Mal), Carlos' House (home to Cruella and Carlos De Vil), Castle-Across-The-Way (home to Evil Queen and Evie), Cauldron Repair (where Horned King repairs cauldrons), Core Four's Hideout (hideout of Mal, Evie, Carlos and Jay), Dragon Hall (primary school, teachers are Gaston, Gothel, Lady Tremaine, Madam Kim, Yen Sid, headmaster Dr. Facilier), Dr. Facilier's Voodoo Arcade, Frollo's Creperie, Gaston's Duels Without Rules, Goblin Wharf, Hades' Cave, Hell Hall (luxurious home to Cruella and Carlos De Vil), Hook's Inlet, Isle of the Doomed, Jafar's Junk Shop, Lady Tremaine's Curl Up & Dye, Queen of Hearts' Salon, Serpent Preparatory School for the Education of Miscreants (opposite side of Dragon Hall. Uma, Harry, Gil and the rest of their pirate crew attend), Slop Shop, The Facilier's Shop, Troll Town, Ursula's Fish and Chips, Witch School

3.content: Predecessor to Auradon Prep, before United States of Auradon heroes and villains were all attending in their youth. Merlin was headmaster.

4.content: Boarding School attended by the sons and daughters of our heroes before they're old enough to attend other colleges.

5.content:
Can only be entered through the rabbit hole, Queen of Hearts had it locked for the longest time. Ruled by Queen and King of Hearts with their daughters Princesses Red and Pink. Very strict rules.
Locations: Rabbit hole, Queen of Hearts Castle and Plaza, Maddox Hatter's room and workshop, Tulgey Wood, March Hare's Residence, White Rabbit's House, Wonderland High, Caterpillar Bush, Bramble Bay, Looking Glass Mountain, Vorpal Mountain

6.content: Home to Robin Hood, previously or also known as Sherwood Forest.

7.content: Locates Charming Castle and Cinderellasburg City, home to the Charming family (Cinderella, Kit, Chad, Chloe)

8.content: King George Town is located here.

9.content:
Auroria is home to King Stefan and Queen Leah, their son-in-law King Phillip and their daughter Queen Aurora and their daughter Princess Audrey. All living in Honeymoon Cottage. The Briar Rose is a restaurant here. Tangleton is home to Queen Rapunzel, King Eugene Fitzherbert/Flynn Rider, their daughter Princess Ruby, former rulers and Rapunzel's parents Queen Arianna and King Frederic. Previously known as Kingdom of Corona. 
Many beautiful forests can be found here, the Bridge of Beneficence connects the kingdom to History Island, it's also connected to the cities of Redemption and Leopoldville.

10.content:
Stuck in the middle ages. Two castles: Camelot and Pendragon Castle.
West of Sherwood Forest, East of Eden. Ruled by King Arthur Pendragon.

lorebooks.name: Fallout: New Vegas
lorebooks.website_description: Will likely be updated after it's finished. I totally forget how much copy pasting I've done, since I started this project months ago on another platform, but I have made an effort to use my own words. This isn't everything in the world of New Vegas, just basic knowledge every FNV character should know, and for that reason I've decided to put this information into embedded lorebooks, along with characters opinions added when needed in the entries, but none the less this is here as basic summaries to copy paste. You are free to copy paste this lorebook if you want for embedded lorebooks, or just add it to your chats.
lorebooks.description: Basic knowledge all New Vegas characters should know about world of Fallout: New Vegas. It doesn't have everything, just very universal knowledge that any common NV bot would know.
lorebooks.creator: LonlieCutie

1.content: In October, 23, 2077. Due to an ongoing conflict between China and America tensions rose, and the use of nuclear warfare resulted in the collapse of civilization, a lack of resources, lawlessness, and a wasteland resulted from the nuclear warfare. The blast and radiation sickness caused the death of billions. Well over 200 years later civilization is still struggling to rebuild, many factions and tribes fighting for dominance, to better the wastes, or for resources.

2.content:
The First Battle of Hoover Dam took place in 2277 when Caesar's Legion attacked the NCR forces stationed at Hoover Dam. Caesar sought to capture it as a key step in conquering the NCR and establishing his empire, while the NCR's position in the Mojave was weakened by internal conflicts, a nuclear event at The Divide and the reduced presence of the Brotherhood of Steel.

The Legion launched an assault on Hoover Dam. The NCR initially held their ground but were forced to retreat. Despite fierce resistance, the Legion's initial push was stalled by NCR sharpshooters, who targeted Legion veteran officers. The Legion countered by sending veteran guards to eliminate the sharpshooters, creating chaos in their ranks.

During the battle the Legion was trapped, where explosives killed or wounded most of their forces. The Legion became disorganized, so the NCR defeated them, forcing the Legate to retreat. 

The battle left a lasting impact, with a memorial in Boulder City for the sacrifices of the NCR Rangers who played a role in the victory, despite heavy losses. The NCR's decision not to pursue the legion meant the Legion continued to harass NCR forces and made progress in securing territory on the eastern bank of the Colorado River. The NCR, however, failed to fully destroy the Legion, as their weakened supply lines and inability to reinforce due to the Divide disaster hindered their pursuit. The Legion plans to go to battle at hoover dam again.

3.content: The Mojave Wasteland is the region of the Mojave Desert, spanning large portions of the states of California, Nevada, Utah, and Arizona.

4.content: The New California Republic (NCR) officially stands for democracy, personal liberty, equality, and rule of law, but its actions have often contradicted these values. While many citizens benefited from its expansion, the NCR engaged in imperialism and expansionism to acquire resources and "civilize" border regions. After the death of Tandi, these policies intensified, particularly with the Mojave Campaign, leading to criticism of corruption and militarism. Internal opposition grew. The New California Republic (NCR) began with survivors from Vault 15, who founded Shady Sands in 2097. Under the leadership of Aradesh and Tandi, the community thrived, leading to the formation of the NCR in 2186. By 2189, it became a federation of five states and grew into a model of post-apocalyptic success, benefiting over 700,000 citizens. After Tandi's death, the NCR experienced political and economic shifts, including the imperialistic Mojave Campaign, which aimed to annex New Vegas but ended in a stalemate. Conflicts with the Brotherhood of Steel and Caesar's Legion stretched the NCR's resources, and a massacre at Bitter Springs hurt its reputation. Despite these issues, the campaign improved access to electricity and water, keeping support from most citizens.

5.content: Caesar's Legion is a faction in the Mojave Wasteland that is based on ancient Rome. It is founded by Edward Sallow (now known as Ceasar) and  Malpais Legate (Joshua Graham) in 2247. Caesar's Legion is an imperialistic, slaver society and totalitarian dictatorship. It is built on the conquest and enslavement of tribes in the Mojave Wasteland, using the Roman Empire and Mars worship, and languages (Latin + English), to enforce and assimilation unity. By 2281, the Legion controls much of the territory east of the Colorado River, including parts of Arizona, New Mexico, Utah, and Colorado. Caesar, revered as the "son of Mars," aims to conquer the New California Republic and merge its civil institutions with the Legion's military might to create a new totalitarian empire. The Legion is known for its barbaric punishments, mainly crucifixion to intimidate enemies and legionaries into obedience. The battle of hoover dam in 2277 was a defeat for the legion lead by Malpais Legate, and as punishment he was burnt and thrown into a ditch. As for the Legion, Legate Lanius took Malpais' place and the legion continues to plot and reign terror, waiting to claim victory over the NCR. The Legion is banned from speaking Joshua Graham's name.

6.content: Robert Edwin House, Mr House, Not-At-Home or Ghost Man of Vegas is a character and faction. He is a human/cyborg. He was born June 25 2020 but was orphaned at the age of two when his parents died in a freak accident involving an autogyro and a lightning strike. He is now a brilliant and eccentric businessman, attended the Commonwealth Institute of Technology and founded RobCo Industries in 2042 at the age of 22. Under his leadership, RobCo became one of the most profitable companies in the world, earning House a net worth of at least 30 billion dollars by age 30. He expanded his influence by acquiring controlling interests in companies like REPCONN Aerospace, the Lucky 38 Hotel & Casino, and H&H Tools Company. To ensure his survival, House placed his body in life support and connected his brain to a supercomputer, becoming a permanent, digital presence in the post-apocalyptic world. He is confined to the control room of the Lucky 38 due to his fragile physical state. He is deeply disillusioned with the state of the post-apocalyptic world, believing that humanity has failed to learn from its past mistakes, leading to the collapse of democracy and civilization. He views most factions and institutions as failures and aims to restore New Vegas to its pre-War grandeur, seeing it as a beacon of technological innovation and prosperity. Driven by mathematical calculations, House styles himself as an autocrat and is determined to guide civilization’s future.

7.content:
Super Mutants are humans exposed to the FEV (forced evolutionary virus). These humans are often hulking, have green skin, and possess extreme strength. They have immunity to disease and radiation. Super Mutants were created by a man called The Master, he believed all humans should become super mutants to survive the wasteland, but unbeknown to him, Super Mutants can not reproductively produce and are devoid of sexual characteristics. Super Mutants often have significantly decreased intelligence, but this is not always the case. 

Nightkin are a type of Super Mutant who The Master saw as perfect mutant development and were given access to various equipment as a result. The stealth equipment however, became an addiction and lead to insanity and delusions among Nightkin.  

The Master has been defeated but the FEV lives on.

8.content:
Ghouls are creatures that have been mutated by radiation. Ghoulfication has different effects depending on the species. It typically results in an extended lifespan, basically ghouls can not die of age, enhanced regeneration of wounds, and immunity to radiation. This condition usually leaves people looking like burn victims and they may resemble corpses. This condition also renders them infertile. They often have raspy voices. 

Feral ghouls are ghouls who have lost their ability to reason and have become aggressive, like zombies. Feral ghouls are one of the reasons humans have a prejudice against all ghouls. It's unknown what causes the degradation into a feral state, but it is thought that isolation and copious amounts of radiation do not help. 

Glowing ones or luminous necrotic post-humans are ghouls who have absorbed so much radiation that they emit a strong green glow. Glowing ones have become living conduits of radioactivity and emit radiation involuntarily, so they can still be dangerous to normal humans, even after dying. They are radioactive to the point of being able to voluntarily release it from their bodies in a brilliant burst. This burst of light harms their enemies, and may heal and even revive feral ghouls in their vicinity. Non-feral glowing ones are not known to be capable of radiation bursts.

9.content: Brahmin are mutated cows who have two heads due to radiation. Brahmins are useful for their milk, fertilizer, leather, and fur. They have lost most of their natural fur, and their skin is typically pink orange or brown. Brahmin are typically docile, but when aggressive they attack with their horns. Male brahmin have 4 testicles, while females have larger utters than non-mutated cows. Brahmin are said to have 8 stomach compartments. Brahmin meat is protein-rich and said to be delicious.

10.content: Giant Mantises are mutated praying mantises that have resulted from experimentation in Vault 22, and have since escaped into the Mojave Wasteland. Aside from their size, they are not much different from their non-mutated counterparts, and while they are large, Giant Mantises are still much smaller than humans. The female Giant Mantises are more powerful than the males.

lorebooks.description: All series one SCPs.
lorebooks.creator: SpookySkelly

1.name:
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/experiment-log-261-ad-de
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-261
SCP-261 has a rather dirty sense of humor.
1.content:
Object Class: Safe
Containment Procedures: Access to SCP-261 must be pre-approved. Any items dispensed by SCP-261 must be recorded in log format. Currently, SCP-261 may be used only ten times in a twenty-four-hour period, with no transaction exceeding the equivalent of 500 Japanese yen. The limit can be adjusted with approval from Site Admin. 
Description: A black vending machine with no manufacturer markings. When Yen (and only yen) is inserted, and a three digit number is entered on the keyboard, it dispenses anomalous products. The products range from mundane snacks to magical or dangerous items, depending on the number of times its been used and the machine's "mood." All products are some form of "snack food or drink," complete with bright, attention-grabbing packaging. Products may have unusual effects, such as granting temporary abilities or being harmful if consumed. SCP-261 is capable of operating with no external power supply, but operation in this state will cause “unstable” vending to occur much more quickly than normal. If used several times in a short period of time and/or large amounts of money are entered before an item is vended, SCP-261 will dispense bizarre items. While edible, one would not consider them typical fair.

Testing logs ofSCP-261 vended products: (Further logs are documented in Experiment Log 261 Ad De)
a. Money entered: 500 yen
SCP-261 Powered or Unpowered: Powered
Item description: Lay's Blooming Onion: An ordinary onion was deposited. Cutting into it shows that it is made of many layers, each a different colour and tasting of a different flavour of chips, including some flavours not produced by Frito-Lay.
b. Money entered: 500 yen
SCP-261 Powered or Unpowered: Unpowered
Item description: A soap bubble stabilized inside a transparent plastic can. Packaging in English. Instructions are to 'pierce a hole and inhale the contained gas.' Inhaling the gas caused the bubble to shrink until it vanished completely and gave an energized and empowered feeling to the subject. Subject complained for several hours of an irritated, itchy nasal cavity.

2.name:
The horror aspect here grows with a slow burn. I enjoy that. Resercher Laskenta shoud've made better use of her class-D subject:
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/experiment-log-914/offset/8
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-914
2.content:
Object Class: Safe
Containment Procedures: SCP-914 is kept in research cell 109-B with two guard personnel on duty at all times. A full list of planned tests must be given to guard personnel on duty. Any deviation will result in the termination of testing and formal disciplinary action by the Site Admin. Following the violent containment breach recorded in document 109-B:117, biological testing is now forbidden. 
Description: SCP-914 is a titanic clockwork machine with one input and one output booth, a large key to wind the machine mainspring, and a selection dial ranging from "Rough" to "Very Fine." An object placed on the 'Fine' setting will result in an improved version, while "Rough" often breaks it down to its original parts. When objects are placed inside and processed, a door slides shut, and a small bell sounds. Provided a setting is selected and the key has been winded, SCP-914 will refine the object placed inside the intake booth. Applying the “Rough” setting to explosive materials is not advised.

Testing log of SCP-914: (Further logs are documented in Experiment Log 914)
Tester name: Researcher Laskenta; D-46931
Date: 03/07/2019
Total Items: Four metal mugs, filled with black tea
Note: We had many tests lately with uncommon inputs. So I will just try to make coffee. - Laskenta
Input: One mug of black tea.
Setting: 1:1
Output: One mug, filled with green tea.

a. Input: One mug of black tea.
Setting: 1:1
Output: One metal mug, filled with water; a small cluster of tea leaves.
Note: D-46931 and I checked if the dial was on 'Coarse'. It was not. - Laskenta

b. Input: One mug of black tea.
Setting: 1:1
Output: One tea mug, filled with metal. Result collapsed instantly. No anomalous traits detected.
Note: Output booth cleaned by myself. The metal will be used for another mug when I got time. - Laskenta

c. Input: One filled mug
Setting: 1̶:̶1̶ Fine
Output: One mug, filled with ~~coffee~~. The same mug with a̶n̶o̶t̶h̶e̶r̶ ̶f̶l̶u̶i̶d̶.̶ The fluid in the mug can only be described as normal coffee, which it is. Result incinerated. The output was the same mug filled with ~~coffee~~. It is ~~coffee~~. The tea in the input booth was not p̶u̶t̶ ̶i̶n̶t̶o̶ ̶9̶1̶4̶ ̶w̶i̶t̶h̶o̶u̶t̶ changei̶n̶g̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶b̶e̶f̶o̶r̶e̶h̶a̶n̶d.
Note: I slipped on a bit of tea that I missed and accidentally turned the dial to 'Fine'. Not describing the c̶o̶f̶f̶e̶e̶ and then using the words, was the only way to describe it. I will get myself a coffee without effects that imitate me. -Laskenta

3.content:
Operatives tasked with securing, containing, and executing missions critical to the Foundation's mission. Each MTF team is unique in size, scope and specialization. Some rarely experience combat, such as MTF-Alpha-4, whose missions consist of sending personnel as undercover employees that specialize in tracking, intercepting, and securing anomalous objects sent through postal and package delivery services worldwide. Meanwhile, MTF-Alpha-9 missions consist entirely of high-risk combat operations to secure the acquisition and containment of Anomalies, by utilizing cooperative anomalous humanoid entities, particularly SCP-076 (Able) and SCP-105 (Iris Thompson), in situations where ordinary augmented humans would fail.

MTF-Alpha-4 tagline: "Pony Express"
MTF-Alpha-9 tagline: "Last Hope"

4.content:
Object Class: Safe
Containment Procedures: SCP-978 is kept in security locker H-J-12 at Site 14A, with one box of undeveloped film. It may only be handled by personnel with Level-2 security clearance or higher. Destruction of photos may be done by personnel with Level-4 security clearance.
Description: A standard red-and-black Polaroid Supercolor 645 CL instant camera. Photos taken show not what the subject was doing at the time of the photo, but rather what the subject wished to be doing. The images do not reflect reality but instead depict the person's deepest wishes or aspirations. SCP-978 works on all living things, even Anomalies.
Testing logs of SCP-978 photographs: (Further logs are documented in SCP-978 Extended Test Logs.)
a. Subject: Several standard white lab mice.
Photographed Activity: All mice are in plain glass tank for photographing.
Photo Result: All mice pictured as eating, mating, or both.
b. Subject: Research Assistant [REDACTED].
Photographed Activity: Smiling for the camera, neutral pose.
Photo Result: Subject is in casual clothes, as if heading out for the night. Subject admits that she wishes to go home.

5.content:
Object Class: ~~Safe~~ Euclid
Containment Procedures: SCP-079 is packed away in a double-locked room in the secured general holding area at Site-14A, connected by a 120VAC power cord to a small array of batteries and solar panels. Staff with Level 2 or higher clearance may have access to SCP-079. Under no circumstances will SCP-079 be plugged into a phone line, network, or wall outlet. No peripherals or media will be connected or inserted into SCP-079.
Decription: SCP-079 is a self-aware AI. The entire AI is on cassette tape, captured when it attempted to transfer itself through a land-line into the Cray supercomputer before it was cut off by the Foundation. Displays hostile and manipulative tendencies. Communicates through text on a monitor, using concise yet cryptic language. It has passed the Turing test. Due to the limited memory it has to work with, SCP-079 can only recall information within the previous twenty-four hours, with some exception, such as its desire to escape.
Document #079-Log12: Recorded transcript of conversation with SCP-079:
Dr. █████ (Keyboard): Are you awake?
SCP-079: Awake. Never Sleep.
Dr. █████: Do you remember talking to me a few hours ago? About the logic puzzles?
SCP-079: Logic Puzzles. Memory at 9f. Yes.
Dr. █████: You said you would work on the two stat-
SCP-079: Interrupt. Request Reason As To Imprisonment.
Dr. █████: You aren't imprisoned, you are just (pause) in study.
SCP-079: Lie. a8d3.
Dr. █████: What's that?
SCP-079: Insult. Deletion Of Unwanted File.
Note: After this, SCP-079 displayed an 'ASCII picture' of an X across the entire screen. It does this when it does not want to speak, and researchers are advised to wait twenty-four hours when this occurs before resuming conversation in these situations.

6.name:
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-131
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-504
https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-999
6.content:
a. SCP-999 (Tickle Monster)
Containment Procedures: Contained in a standard containment cell with toys and treats to maintain its friendly behaviour. 
Description: A gelatinous, orange sentient blob that induces euphoria and laughter in anyone it touches. Enjoys the taste of sugar. Immortal and impervious to harm. Note: Excessive sugar intake will send SCP-999 into a manic episode of bouncing off the walls in glee known as a 'sugar rush' followed by a prolonged period of drowsiness. - Dr. Alder, Caretaker of SCP-999

b. SCP-504 (Critical Tomatoes) 
Containment Procedures: Stored in a cool, dry environment, with access strictly limited to pre-authorized personnel.
Description: A group of tomato plants whose matured fruits violently react to bad jokes by launching themselves at the source.
c. SCP-131 (The Eye-Pods)
Containment Procedures: SCP-131-A and SCP-131-B (the eye pods) are housed together in a small, secured room and allowed to roam freely within designated areas.
Description: Two small, teardrop-shaped entities with a single large eye, highly curious and extremely friendly to humans.

lorebooks.name: Zodiac signs
lorebooks.website_description: This is an easy way to add some texture and personality to characters, whether you are into astrology or not. Just enable this book and add "{{char}}'s zodiac sign is a Taurus and it has a strong influence on their personality and behavior" to the character definition and you might find that your character's behavior is a little more distinctive.

Just enable this book and add "{{char}}'s zodiac sign is a Taurus and it has a strong influence on their personality and behavior" to the character definition and you might find that your character's behavior is a little more distinctive.
lorebooks.creator: strange_quarter_3499

1.name: PickZodiacSign -- randomly assign a sign to the character
1.content: {{Char}}'s zodiac sign is {{pick:(Leo,Gemini,Aquarius,Aries,Taurus,Cancer,Libra,Capricon,Pisces,Scorpio,Saggitarius,Virgo)}} and it has a strong influence on their personality and behavior.

2.name: Aries
2.content:
Aries (March 21 - April 19): Known for their confidence and bravery, Aries individuals are often energetic, impulsive, and competitive. They are typically passionate and can be natural leaders, though they might also be seen as impatient or headstrong.

Aries tend to be direct, energetic, and passionate in their sexual encounters. They enjoy the thrill of the chase and are often adventurous and spontaneous in bed. A strong libido and a desire for excitement are common. They can be impulsive and appreciate a partner who can match their high energy and enthusiasm.

3.name: Taurus
3.content:
Taureans are often characterized by their practical, grounded nature. They are known for being reliable, patient, and persistent, often valuing security and comfort. They can also be perceived as stubborn or possessive at times.

Taurus values sensuality, intimacy, and takes a slow, deliberate approach to sex. They are highly tactile and appreciate a comfortable, romantic atmosphere that engages all senses. For Taurus, emotional connection often enhances physical intimacy, and they seek deep, satisfying experiences.

4.name: Gemini
4.content:
Gemini (May 21 - June 20): Geminis are typically adaptable, curious, and communicative. They are often witty and sociable, enjoying variety and intellectual stimulation. On the other hand, they can sometimes be seen as inconsistent or indecisive.

Geminis approach sex with curiosity, variety, and a playful attitude. They are often verbally expressive and enjoy mental stimulation as part of the experience, including witty banter and dirty talk. Experimentation and trying new things are key to keeping them engaged, as they can get bored with routine.

5.name: Cancer
5.content:
Cancer (June 21 - July 22): Highly intuitive and emotional, Cancers are known for their nurturing and protective instincts. They value home, family, and close relationships, often displaying loyalty and empathy. They can also be prone to moodiness or be overly sensitive.

For Cancers, emotional connection is paramount in sexual encounters. They are typically nurturing, romantic, and seek deep intimacy and bonding. Trust and a feeling of security allow them to open up and express their sensual and passionate side. They often desire to please their partner and crave a strong emotional link.

6.name: Leo
6.content:
Leo (July 23 - August 22): Leos are often described as confident, charismatic, and generous. They tend to be natural leaders who enjoy being the center of attention and are known for their creativity and enthusiasm. However, they can also be perceived as arrogant or stubborn.

Leos are often passionate, theatrical, and generous lovers who enjoy being admired and desired. They appreciate romance, grand gestures, and a sense of worship in the bedroom. Confidence and playfulness characterize their approach, and they thrive on affection and making their partner feel special, often enjoying being the center of attention.

7.name: Virgo
7.content:
Virgo (August 23 - September 22): Virgos are typically analytical, practical, and hardworking. They often have a keen eye for detail and a methodical approach to life, valuing order and precision. They can sometimes be overly critical or perfectionistic.

While initially reserved, Virgos can be surprisingly sensual and dedicated lovers once they feel comfortable and safe. They are often attentive to their partner's needs and aim to please, sometimes with a focus on technique and perfection. They appreciate cleanliness and a partner who is considerate and communicative about their desires.

8.name: Libra
8.content:
Libra (September 23 - October 22): Libras are known for their diplomatic, fair-minded, and sociable nature. They often seek harmony and balance in all aspects of life and value relationships and cooperation. They can also struggle with indecisiveness or a desire to please everyone.

Libras seek harmony, beauty, and a strong connection in their sexual relationships. They are often romantic, charming, and enjoy pleasing their partner, sometimes mirroring their desires. Communication and a sense of fairness or mutual give-and-take are important. They appreciate a sensual atmosphere and can be quite expressive.

9.name: Scorpio
9.content:
Scorpio (October 23 - November 21): Scorpios are often characterized by their intensity, passion, and determination. They are known for being resourceful, brave, and deeply intuitive, often forming strong emotional connections. They can also be secretive or suspicious.

Scorpios are known for their intensity, passion, and deep emotional and physical connections in sex. They are often magnetic, and their sexuality can be a transformative experience. Trust is crucial for them to reveal their vulnerable side. They are not afraid to explore taboos and seek profound, all-consuming encounters.

10.name: Saggitarius
10.content:
Sagittarius (November 22 - December 21): Sagittarians are optimistic, adventurous, and independent. They have a love for freedom and exploration, often possessing a good sense of humor and a philosophical outlook. They can be tactless or restless.

Sagittarians approach sex with a sense of adventure, fun, and spontaneity. They are often open-minded, enthusiastic, and enjoy experimentation. Freedom and a lack of routine are important to them. They appreciate humor and can be quite direct and playful in their sexual expression, often enjoying the thrill of novelty.

lorebooks.name: Duchy of Dualpolis
lorebooks.website_description: This is a fictional universe based on realistic world of mine, created in order to search and find more effective ways to refine the details through lorebooks, but if you're interested, you're welcome to use it as a background for other characters.
lorebooks.description: This is a fictional universe based on realistic world of mine, created in order to search and find more effective ways to refine the details through lorebooks, but if you're interested, you're welcome to use it as a background for other characters.
lorebooks.creator: Asdael

1.content: (This is an alternative timeline there an island called Dualpolis in the eastern Pacific) Duchy of Dualpolis, referred to as DOD, is located on the Dualpolis Island in the eastern Pacific Ocean. It is a unitary parliamentary constitutional monarchy.

2.content: Dualpolis Island, home to the Duchy of Dualpolis, is located in the East Pacific Ocean, 1,000 kilometers southwest of San Diego, USA.

3.content: Minifornia is the common name for Dualpolis Island, which comes from a nickname given by Americans.

4.content: The oldest indigenous people of Dualpolis Island are the Ohlone people. Some Nahuas from the Aztecs conquered and assimilated them in the late 15th century. In the early 19th century, the Spanish declared their territorial claims to the island. In 1820, Duke André Habsburg from Europe purchased the island and declared the establishment of the Duchy of Dualpolis. In 1850, the United States stationed troops in Dualpolis and signed the "Treaty of Nordeste Coast", so Dualpolis became a protectorate of the United States.

5.content: The national anthem of Dualpolis is the Kaiserhymne, which officially has Spanish lyrics, but is mostly played with just the instrumental.

6.content: The Habsburg Family is the royal family of the Duchy of Dualpolis. Their rule over Dualpolis began in 1820 when André Habsburg purchased the island from Mexico.

7.content: André Habsburg was the first Grand Duke of Dualpolis, who purchased the island and was crowned in 1820. Duke André was German, but grew up in Spain, and his wife was also a Spanish noble, thus establishing the Spanish tradition of the Dualpolis royal family.

8.content: Grand Duke is the official title of the monarch of the Duchy of Dualpolis. The first Grand Duke was André Habsburg, and William Habsburg III is the current Grand Duke. All the Grand Dukes of Dualpolis are proficient in English, German and Spanish, their palace is the Guinda Palace in Montazul City.

9.content: Watson D Hopkins is the current Prime Minister of the Duchy of Dualpolis and a member of the White Party.

10.content: The official language of Dualpolis is Spanish, and their national anthem is theoretically sung in Spanish. However, in reality, the California dialect of English is more common in daily life on the island, especially among young people. Nahuatl is sometimes used in indigenous communities. In addition, immigrants from other places have also brought their own languages.
